title: Quantitative Crypto Analyst
description: Job Description: The Group Fidelity Digital Asset Management [FDAM] is building an investment platform offering digital asset products and services designed to meet the growing needs of Fidelity’s retail customers and intermediary and institutional clients. The Investment Implementation team is a collaborative group proficient in off-chain and on-chain market structure, trading, liquidity venues, reconciliation and risk management. The team will work closely with Research, Investment Operations, Data Science and Risk across topics such as portfolio construction, rebalancing, collateral management, technology infrastructure and automating processes. The Role We are seeking a Quantitative Crypto Analyst to join the Fidelity Digital Asset Management business and report directly to the Head of Research. This team of multi-disciplinary research analysts will be focused on developing frameworks for the evaluation of tokens, and the associated blockchain and protocols, that form the basis of the rapidly evolving blockchain economy. The Analyst will initially be focused on building ML models, factor models, and portfolio construction. One of the primary objectives of this team is to bring the rigor and discipline found in the best investment research teams in traditional asset management to the world of digital assets. Members of this team must have a track record of conducting high quality hands-on investment-oriented research coupled with a demonstrated knowledge of crypto and ability to apply critical thinking to evaluating utility of blockchain networks and associated protocols. The Research team’s output will enable the development of passive and active investment products that allow Fidelity’s customers to gain exposure to growth in this exciting new asset class. The Value You Deliver The Quantitative Crypto Analyst will have three main deliverables: Data organization: Partnering with quant researchers, data scientists and technologists on identifying, collecting and organizing the data necessary to conduct the research that enables developing investment management products. Decision tools and models: Creating quantitative tools for assessing trading and liquidity profiles of the various cryptocurrencies and tokens to inform market positioning and risk. Strategy development: Using data organization above, developing systematic approaches to portfolio construction, risk management and trading. Education And Experience 2+ years of relevant experience working with on-chain data Strong background in quantitative research, including programming, time series modeling, optimizations, and machine learning Familiarity with crypto data vendors, data sources and fundamental data Experience with portfolio construction for an asset manager a plus Advanced degree in Engineering, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, or a closely related field is encouraged The Skills You Bring Strong hands-on research capabilities and an ability to communicate research to a broad audience Ability to engage with multiple investment and technology teams to establish a collaborative and interdisciplinary approach to crypto and token research Familiarity with modern technology and programming platforms. E.g., Python, SQL and cloud-oriented data technology (AWS, Azure, S3, Snowflake) Certifications: Company Overview Fidelity Investments is a privately held company with a mission to strengthen the financial well-being of our clients. We help people invest and plan for their future. We assist companies and non-profit organizations in delivering benefits to their employees. And we provide institutions and independent advisors with investment and technology solutions to help invest their own clients’ money. Join Us At Fidelity, you’ll find endless opportunities to build a meaningful career that positively impacts peoples’ lives, including yours. You can take advantage of flexible benefits that support you through every stage of your career, empowering you to thrive at work and at home. Honored with a , we have been recognized by our employees as a top 10 Best Place to Work in 2024. And you don’t need a finance background to succeed at Fidelity—we offer a range of opportunities for learning so you can build the career you’ve always imagined. blends the best of working offsite with maximizing time together in person to meet associate and business needs. Currently, most hybrid roles require associates to work onsite all business days of one assigned week per four-week period (beginning in September 2024, the requirement will be two full assigned weeks). At Fidelity, we value honesty, integrity, and the safety of our associates and customers within a heavily regulated industry . Certain roles may require candidates to go through a preliminary credit check during the screening process. Candidates who are presented with a Fidelity offer will need to go through a background investigation, , and may be asked to provide additional documentation as requested. This investigation includes but is not limited to a criminal, civil litigations and regulatory review, employment, education, and credit review (role dependent). These investigations will account for 7 years or more of history, depending on the role. Where permitted by federal or state law, Fidelity will also conduct a pre-employment drug screen, which will review for the following substances: Amphetamines, THC (marijuana), cocaine, opiates, phencyclidine. We invite you to Find Your Fidelity at . Fidelity Investments is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that the most effective way to attract, develop and retain a diverse workforce is to build an enduring culture of inclusion and belonging. Fidelity will reasonably accommodate applicants with disabilities who need adjustments to participate in the application or interview process. To initiate a request for an accommodation, contact the HR Accommodation Team by sending an email to . We welcome those with experience in jobs such as Accounting Manager, Financial Analyst, and Field Client Relationship Manager and others in the Accounting and Finance to apply.

title: Business Analyst- GTM Analytics
description: About G2 - Our People G2 was founded to create a place where people will love to work. We strive to create meaning in work and provide more than just a job: a true calling. At the heart of our community and culture are our people. Our global G2 team comes from a wide range of backgrounds and experiences, and that’s what makes our G2 community strong and vibrant. We want everyone to bring their authentic selves to work, and we do this through our company and team events, our G2 Gives charitable initiatives, and our Employee Resource Groups (ERGs). Our employee-led, leadership-supported ERGs celebrate the diversity of our team, foster inclusivity and belonging, and create a space to connect to each other. Through connections and understanding, we build a stronger and more dynamic global team and help every person reach their personal peak. We support our employees by offering generous benefits, such as flexible work, ample parental leave, and unlimited PTO. Click here to learn more about our benefits. About G2 - The Company When you join G2 , you join the global team behind the largest and most trusted software marketplace. Every month, 5.5 million people come to G2 to inform smarter software decisions based on honest peer reviews. Authenticity is our focus, and every day we help thousands of companies, and hundreds of employees, propel their potential. Ready for meaningful work that starts and ends with compassion and heart? You’ve come to the right place. G2 is going through exciting growth! We’ve recently secured our Series D funding of $157 million, which will further allow us to grow and develop our product and people. Read about it here ! About The Role G2 is looking for a Business Analyst to join our growing GTM Analytics team! Your role will be instrumental in accelerating growth by providing the Sales organization with key insights around Partnerships to help close new business and renewal opportunities. In This Role, You Will Analyze key business drivers, trends, and operating metrics, translating data into insights and recommendations to Account Management leadership. Create data visualizations that simplify complex information in a robust, accurate, and appealing visual story that engages stakeholders and drives them to action. Document, monitor, and proactively recommend improvement to data processes and key metrics while quantifying the impact of changes for leaders Help develop Single Source of Truth (SSOT) data frameworks to enable GTM analytics across various data sources and data grains that allow efficient drillability into critical data attributes and components while establishing proper governance on stability and scalability of source data Collaborate with cross-functional teams responsible for implementing projects in support of functional and company wide business objectives Minimum Qualifications We realize applying for jobs can feel daunting at times. Even if you don’t check all the boxes in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. 3+ years of experience in sales or marketing operations, data analytics or related field. Advanced knowledge of Snowflake, Redshift and Salesforce, familiarity with related CRM integrations (ZoomInfo, Clari, Marketo, Zendesk) Experience with using SQL to work on building data views and understanding of data warehouses such as (Snowflake, Databricks, Redshift) Advanced knowledge of analytical tools ranging from Excel and GSheets to visualization platforms such as Looker, Tableau, CRMA, SiSense and others. Experience working with a fast paced growth environment and proven ability to manage multiple initiatives. Strong attention to detail, with ability to work cross functionally in a fast-paced environment Excellent verbal and written communication, with ability to simplify complex concepts. Excellent verbal and written communication. Focused on identifying problems with creative solutions. Our Commitment to Inclusivity and Diversity At G2, we are committed to creating an inclusive and diverse environment where people of every background can thrive and feel welcome. We consider applicants without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, genetic information, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, pregnancy, age, or marital, veteran, or physical or mental disability status. Learn more about our commitments here . -- For job applicants in California, the United Kingdom, and the European Union, please review this applicant privacy notice before applying to this job.

title: IT Infrastructure Engineer (Linux)
description: WHO WE ARE AND WHAT WE ARE PASSIONATE ABOUT: Elevate is a nonprofit organization headquartered in Chicago. We design and implement programs that reduce costs, protect people and the environment, and ensure the benefits of clean and efficient energy reach those who need them most. We're pursuing our mission of a just and equitable world where everyone has affordable heat, power, and water in their homes and communities. We are growing nationally – expanding the reach of our programs, services, and research in collaboration with partner organizations. OUR PEOPLE AND CULTURE: At Elevate, our organization's greatest asset is the people we attract. Elevate employees co-create our energetic and collaborative environment, where constant learning and service to others take priority. We want our team to challenge conventional thinking in pursuit of innovation. We seek dynamic, hardworking individuals inspired to work with people of diverse backgrounds and perspectives. Every day we make a difference by placing our team, clients, and community partners first. From our mission to our focus on staff well-being and career development opportunities, there's no better place to grow your career than Elevate. Interested in learning more? Keep on reading for the details. IT Infrastructure Engineer The IT Infrastructure Engineer role requires a wide range of technical skills, including system and server management, exchange administration, and networking configuration. The role also involves vendor management, support for the IT team, and domain management. Additionally, the successful candidate must support Elevate Energy’s flexible work hours. The IT Infrastructure Engineer reports to the IT Director. This position is in Chicago, Illinois and is hybrid. Responsibilities Supporting the Tech Services team in their efforts to maintain and improve the organization’s IT systems. Managing all tools and software that the organization acquires and that are needed for the business. This includes tools such as M365, Azure, AirTable, Atlassian Products, and more. Managing vendor relationships, including meeting with vendors, negotiating contracts, and purchasing products and services as needed. Administering the organization’s Exchange server. Linux server administration. This includes user and security administration, server patching, new server and database configuration, server monitoring, and anti-virus. Software installation and patching for Linux web servers, such as Apache webserver and Tomcat. Providing escalated support for the IT support team. Managing all domains associated with the organization’s IT systems. Configuring and managing networking infrastructure, including firewall management. Providing on-premise infrastructure support and management, including managing and configuring devices such as access points, firewalls, switches, routers, and NAS. Managing servers and ensuring that they are patched and configured properly. This includes Hyper-V management. Supporting Elevate Energy’s flexible work hours, including normal business hours and on-call rotation. Ensuring that backups are performed regularly, and that data is properly protected. Provide superior, timely customer service to both internal and external customers throughout ticket process, documenting communications from ticket creation through closure via the IT Team’s ticketing system. Ensuring that backups are performed regularly, and that data is properly protected along with creating and maintaining backup policies. Create and update documentation that includes but is not limited to network configurations, troubleshooting procedures, and operational best practices. Provisioning and maintain storage (cloud & on-premise). Manage Web Access Firewall for outward facing servers Qualifications and Skills 2-4 years of experience Azure and M365 experience Proficient in Linux security and administration Proficient in implementing and maintaining HyperV/VMWare VSphere, WAN/LAN Networking, SQL Server Management Preferred Microsoft Azure Certification (AZ-900) Preferred Microsoft Azure Certification (AZ-104) Knowledge of Powershell, Active Directory & Entra ID, and licenses Ability to lift 40 pounds Compensation The total compensation for this position includes health and welfare benefits (medical, dental, vision, etc.), defined contribution benefit (401k with contribution), professional development, generous paid time off policies, and a flexible schedule. This is an exempt individual contributor position with a salary range of $75,000 – $90,000, based on experience. Anti-Discrimination Policy Elevate is an equal opportunity employer that does not discriminate against any employee or job applicant based on race, color, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, or marital status. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including, but not limited to, hiring, termination, promotion, transfer, layoff, leaves of absence, compensation, and training. ADA Accommodation Elevate will reasonably accommodate qualified individuals with a disability so that they can perform the essential functions of a job unless doing so causes a direct threat to these individuals or others in the workplace, and the threat cannot be eliminated by reasonable accommodation, or if the accommodation creates an undue hardship to Elevate. Contact the People Team with any questions or requests for accommodations.

title: Lead Data Engineer
description: Position Overview Navistar is not just building trucks - it's forging the future of mobility. As a global industry pioneer, Navistar is assembling a team of makers, problem solvers, and future world builders. Together, we are not just imagining a better world - We're shaping it, one innovative solution at a time. Join Navistar now and be a part of the journey towards a brighter, more connected tomorrow. We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Lead Data Engineer to join our Digital Solutions Team. As a Lead Data Engineer, you will design, develop, and operationalize the MDM platform which includes building data pipelines to integrate data sources to MDM Platform, tuning matching algorithms and developing APIs to enable master data consumption. This is a hybrid position based three days per week at our headquarters in Lisle, Illinois. Responsibilities Design, develop, optimize, and maintain data pipelines, storage, and compute components using Azure Services Collaborate with cross-functional teams to collect and review MDM requirements and translate them into technical design documents. Perform data analysis and profiling using Collibra data quality platform to support Data Governance initiatives. Foster a culture of sharing, re-use, design for scale, stability, and operational efficiency of data and analytical solutions. Partner with Enterprise Architecture to develop detailed design documents that would be leveraged for development Minimum Requirements Bachelor’s degree At least 5 years of data quality and/or data engineering and/or analytics or statistical analysis experience OR Master’s degree At least 3 years of data quality and/or data engineering and/or analytics or statistical analysis experience OR At least 7 years of data quality and/or data engineering and/or analytics or statistical analysis experience Desired Skills Hands-on experience with MDM tools like Informatica (IDMC/IICS), Reltio or Stibo STEP platform Solid knowledge of data integration patterns, data matching techniques Strong proficiency in PLSQL, Spark, PySpark, Python and Pandas Hands-on experience in Azure Data Factory or Informatica Power center and any data quality tool (Informatica or Talend DQ, Trilium or Ataccama) Experience with DevOps tools like Azure DevOps or Jenkins Exceptional communication and collaboration skills to understand business partner needs and deliver solutions Intellectual curiosity to understand and answer questions Intellectual humility to leverage the expertise of others Exemplary organizational skills with attention to detail & accuracy Openness to working in agile environments with multiple stakeholders. Professional attitude and service orientation; team player Good communication and collaboration skills Company Overview Navistar, Inc. (“Navistar”) is a purpose-driven company, reimagining how to deliver what matters to create more cohesive relationships, build higher-performing teams and find solutions where others don’t. Based in Lisle, Illinois, Navistar or its subsidiaries and affiliates produce International® brand commercial trucks and engines, IC Bus® brand school and commercial buses, all-makes OnCommand® Connection advanced connectivity services, and Fleetrite®, ReNEWeD® and Diamond Advantage® brand aftermarket parts. With a history of innovation dating back to 1831, Navistar has more than 14,500 employees worldwide and is part of TRATON SE, a global champion of the truck and transport services industry. Additional information is available at www.Navistar.com. Accelerating the Impact of Sustainable Mobility Visit us at www.Navistar.com to discover more about our organization Navistar is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. If you are a qualified individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to access the online application system or participate in the interview process due to your disability, please email HRC@Navistar.com to request assistance. title: Data Warehouse Engineer
description: Position Summary The Data Warehouse Engineer is a key technical role responsible for the design, development, maintenance, and optimization of data warehouse processes. This includes creating and maintaining ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes, defining database architecture, and assisting in cloud migration efforts. The Data Warehouse Engineer collaborates with cross-functional teams to deliver data solutions that support Business Intelligence and analytics, ensuring data is accurate, timely, and easily accessible Duties & Responsibilities Design, develop, and maintain data warehouse ETL processes to ensure accurate and timely data availability for business intelligence and analytics. Define and implement efficient database architecture, including data modeling, indexing, partitioning, and performance tuning. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, define data integration and transformation strategies, and deliver data solutions. Assist in migrating existing on-premise data infrastructure to cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform). Monitor and troubleshoot data pipeline performance, ensuring data quality, and addressing any data-related issues. Stay up-to-date with the latest data engineering best practices, tools, and technologies to continuously improve and optimize data warehouse processes. Develop and maintain technical documentation, including data flow diagrams, data dictionaries, and system specifications. Education & Experience Knowledge Of Proficiency in SQL and experience with various database management systems (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle, SQL Server). Solid understanding of data warehouse concepts, including star schema, snowflake schema, and dimensional modeling. Experience with ETL tools such as Microsoft SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS). Knowledge of cloud platforms and experience in cloud migration, specifically with AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform. Strong programming skills in languages such as Python, Java, or Scala. Knowledge of data visualization tools such as IBM Cognos, Tableau, or Power BI. Ability To Excellent problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and ability to work effectively both independently and in a team environment. Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders Ability to lead and influence discussions across a variety of stakeholders to achieve results and proactively address sources of conflict Self-starter with great communication skills (verbal and written) Education And Training Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or a related field. A Master's degree is preferred. Minimum two years of experience in the technology industry, knowledge of the Financial Industry is a plus. 3+ years of experience in data engineering, ETL development, and database management. Certifications in data engineering, database management, or cloud platforms is a plus. Requires knowledge of Microsoft Office. Busey values a diverse and inclusive workplace and strives to recruit, develop and retain individuals with exceptional talent. A team with diverse talent, working together, is essential to Busey’s commitment of delivering service excellence. Busey is an Equal Opportunity Employer including Disability/Vets. Visit Busey.com/Careers to learn more about Busey’s Equal Opportunity Employment.

title: Principal, Competitive Intelligence
description: Your work days are brighter here. At Workday, it all began with a conversation over breakfast. When our founders met at a sunny California diner, they came up with an idea to revolutionize the enterprise software market. And when we began to rise, one thing that really set us apart was our culture. A culture which was driven by our value of putting our people first. And ever since, the happiness, development, and contribution of every Workmate is central to who we are. Our Workmates believe a healthy employee-centric, collaborative culture is the essential mix of ingredients for success in business. That’s why we look after our people, communities and the planet while still being profitable. Feel encouraged to shine, however that manifests: you don’t need to hide who you are. You can feel the energy and the passion, it's what makes us unique. Inspired to make a brighter work day for all and transform with us to the next stage of our growth journey? Bring your brightest version of you and have a brighter work day here. About The Team Are you someone who is highly motivated and has extensive experience in sales and competitive strategies? Are you seeking an opportunity to make a significant impact in a world-class organization? Look no further! Workday Inc is searching for an individual with a passion for sales and competitive intelligence to join our world-class team as a Field Intelligence analyst. About The Role At Workday, we are committed to delivering exceptional results and our Field Intelligence team plays a crucial role in providing actionable information to our sellers, sales leadership, and other teams across the organization. As a Field Intelligence Analyst, you analyze competitive intelligence research including customer and market feedback to deliver winning insights and enablement sessions that are well-sourced, consumable, and actionable for sales and sales leadership. This is a unique opportunity to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment where your insights will directly contribute to our success. Responsibilities: Collaborate with sellers, sales leadership, and other teams to develop strategies that will enable us to compete effectively in the market. Develop and deliver competitive insights to effectively communicate findings and recommendations to sales leadership. Collaborate with sales teams to develop competitive strategic approaches for key deals. Create and maintain resources such as battlecards and competitive strategy guides. Develop strong cross-functional relationships across the organization. Continuously contribute and support our intelligence gathering processes to ensure flawless execution. About You Basic Qualifications: 10+ years of proven Sales and/or Sales Operations experience with a track record of success 10+ years of interpreting research and data from a sales perspective. Other Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in a relevant field or equivalent experience. Excellent communication and presentation skills Experienced going through a sales process, thourogh understanding of the sales cycle. Previous experience as an Account Executive or Regional Sales Director Meticulous and capable of effectively handling multiple projects at once. Demonstrated leadership qualities, able to inspire and lead cross-functional teams. Workday Pay Transparency Statement The annualized base salary ranges for the primary location and any additional locations are listed below. Workday pay ranges vary based on work location. As a part of the total compensation package, this role may be eligible for the Workday Bonus Plan or a role-specific commission/bonus, as well as annual refresh stock grants. Recruiters can share more detail during the hiring process. Each candidate’s compensation offer will be based on multiple factors including, but not limited to, geography, experience, skills, job duties, and business need, among other things. For more information regarding Workday’s comprehensive benefits, please click here. Primary Location: USA.CA.Pleasanton Primary Location Base Pay Range: $162,200 USD - $243,300 USD Additional US Location(s) Base Pay Range: $131,100 USD - $243,300 USD Our Approach to Flexible Work With Flex Work, we’re combining the best of both worlds: in-person time and remote. Our approach enables our teams to deepen connections, maintain a strong community, and do their best work. We know that flexibility can take shape in many ways, so rather than a number of required days in-office each week, we simply spend at least half (50%) of our time each quarter in the office or in the field with our customers, prospects, and partners (depending on role). This means you'll have the freedom to create a flexible schedule that caters to your business, team, and personal needs, while being intentional to make the most of time spent together. Those in our remote "home office" roles also have the opportunity to come together in our offices for important moments that matter. Pursuant to applicable Fair Chance law, Workday will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. Workday is an Equal Opportunity Employer including individuals with disabilities and protected veterans. Are you being referred to one of our roles? If so, ask your connection at Workday about our Employee Referral process! ,

title: System Engineer Low Latency
description: Low Latency Systems Engineer: Join an innovative and sophisticated team, where you'll be at the forefront of a real-time production trading environment. We're looking for passionate individuals who thrive on solving complex challenges in a mission-critical, fast-paced environment. If you have a dedication to automation, and a desire to innovate in the realm of high availability, high throughput, and low-latency solutions, we want you on our team. Responsibilities: Design, implement, and maintain scalable infrastructure solutions for our real-time production trading systems. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define system requirements and ensure that systems meet performance goals. Monitor system performance and troubleshoot issues across our distributed systems to ensure high availability and low-latency operation. Automate deployment, configuration, and management tasks to streamline operations and improve efficiency. Implement and maintain security best practices to protect our systems and data integrity. Continuously evaluate and recommend improvements to existing systems and infrastructure. Requirements: Proven experience designing, deploying, and supporting high-performance, low-latency systems in a production environment. Expertise in installation, configuration, and troubleshooting of Linux systems. Experience with automation tools and configuration management. Solid understanding of networking concepts, protocols, and security. Ability to troubleshoot complex issues methodically and efficiently. Excellent communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively in a dynamic team environment. Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent practical experience).

title: Marketing Specialist - Database
description: Solutions for Today’s Challenges. Vision for Tomorrow’s Opportunities. Join William Blair, the Premier Global Boutique. William Blair has delivered trusted advice for nearly nine decades, and we continue to deepen our expertise and relationships across regions, asset classes, and markets throughout North America, Europe, Asia, and Australia. We are committed to our people and culture, values, clients, and local communities. What sets us apart is that we are an independent partnership, with employees who have unique experiences, perspectives, and backgrounds. We provide advisory services, strategies, and solutions to meet clients’ evolving needs amid dynamic market conditions and varying industries. We strive to attract the most qualified, passionate candidates who specialize in investment banking, investment management, private wealth management, and a variety of other business functions. We work tirelessly to create an inclusive culture and take pride in fostering employees’ professional and personal growth. We empower our people to bring their best thinking each day so we can deliver the tailored, thoughtful work and problem-solving abilities that our clients expect. Equally, we are proud of our long-term partnerships with the communities in which we live and work, a legacy we inherited from our founder. We invite you to learn about how we are seeking excellence in everything we do and empowering our clients’ success with passion, creativity, and rigor. For more information, visit williamblair.com. The Marketing Specialist - Database will build knowledge of William Blair institutional investment strategies and products. Obtain information on investment philosophy, features, and performance of specific investment products. Complete and maintain information on Investment Management division in third-party databases and provide analytical support to IM business development and client service teams across all IM business units. Responsibilities May Include But Are Not Limited To Continually monitor and update external consultant and independent database providers and act as a subject matter expert for similar data in RFPs to ensure consistency within proposals. Provide analytical support to business development and client service teams across Investment Management as directed by senior database analyst. Develop strong knowledge of all William Blair Investment Management data systems and their differing purposes and functionalities. Ensure all work activities are in compliance with applicable rules, regulations, policies and procedures. Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in Finance related field preferred 2 – 5 years of experience in database marketing preferred; financial services industry experience required CFA Institute Investment Foundations certification preferred Project management and prioritization skills Strong analytical skills Ability to collaborate across multiple functions Attention to detail and quality Knowledge of investment concepts, products and applicable regulations Proficiency in Microsoft Office William Blair is an equal opportunity employer. It complies with all laws and regulations that prohibit discrimination in employment practice because of race, color, religion, creed, ancestry, marital status, gender, age, national origin, sexual orientation, unfavorable discharge from the military service or on the basis of a physical or mental disability that is unrelated to the employee's ability to perform the duties of the job applied for. EOE m/f/d/v Be aware of hiring scams : William Blair has clear processes and guidelines with regards to recruiting. We do not request personal financial information in connection with an employment application nor does William Blair extend any employment offers without first conducting an interview through one of its registered offices. William Blair does not use instant messaging services such as WhatsApp, Telegram, or iMessage as part of the recruiting or interviewing process. Note to External Recruiters / Search Firms : William Blair does not accept unsolicited resumes and will not pay for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. Any unsolicited resumes received will not be considered as a valid submission. title: Lead Data Engineer (Python, SQL, Snowflake) - P3224
description: 84.51° Overview 84.51° is a retail data science, insights and media company. We help The Kroger Co., consumer packaged goods companies, agencies, publishers and affiliates create more personalized and valuable experiences for shoppers across the path to purchase. Powered by cutting-edge science, we utilize first-party retail data from more than 62 million U.S. households sourced through the Kroger Plus loyalty card program to fuel a more customer-centric journey using 84.51° Insights, 84.51° Loyalty Marketing and our retail media advertising solution, Kroger Precision Marketing. Join us at 84.51°! __________________________________________________________ As a Lead Data Engineer, you will have the opportunity to design and build software products and features for both internal and external clients. We are a team of innovators, continuously exploring new technologies that ensure 84.51° remains on the forefront of application development. In this position, you will be utilizing Python, SQL, Azure Cloud Services, Databricks and Snowflake. As part of the Identity & Privacy engineering team, you will be working in a new space that will be using audience and insights data in order to facilitate identity resolution for offsite activations in a cookie-less future and determining when we can contact customers. Identity capabilities also includes understanding our customers with every touchpoint in-store and online, where profiling and behavioral insights are maintained in order to inform our business. Responsibilities Take ownership of stories and drive them to completion through all phases of the entire 84.51° SDLC. This includes external facing and internal applications as well as process improvement activities such as: Design and develop Python & SQL based data pipeline solutions Perform unit and integration testing Create quality checks for ingested and post processed data Ensure alerting and monitoring of automated pipeline solutions Provide mentoring to junior team members Participate in retrospective reviews Participate in the estimation process for new work and releases Maintain and enhance existing applications Bring new perspectives to problems Be driven to improve yourself and the way things are done Requirements Bachelor’s degree (Master’s degree desired) typically in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Mathematics, Business Analytics or another technically strong program. Understanding of Agile Principles (Scrum) 5+ years of proven professional Python and SQL development experience Proficient with distributed data processing (PySpark, Snowpark) Proficient with automated testing (PyTest, etc…) Proficient with GitHub Experience using Python frameworks Experience with Cloud Technologies & Services (Azure preferred, GCP, AWS) Experience with dependency management (Conda, venv, etc) Experience with performance tuning enterprise applications Experience with debugging enterprise applications Experience with RESTful APIs Understanding of CI/CD Understanding of Object Oriented Principles Understanding SOLID principles Preferred Skills Python & SQL Development Distributed Data Processing (PySpark, Snowpark) CI/CD practices Automated data pipeline orchestration Data observability – Logging, Monitoring, and Alerting (Datadog) Azure Cloud infrastructure development Snowflake Databricks API development Data quality checks Cloud Technologies IMPORTANT INFO This is a Hybrid position. Candidates must be able to come into the office on Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday of each week. We have locations in Cincinnati, OH, Chicago, IL, Deerfield, IL, New York, NY, and Portland, OR. There are no remote options for this position. We are not working with staffing firms, consulting companies, or any other 3rd parties on this particular position. Full-time only, no contracts, no C2C. Also, please do not contact me about any products or services, as I have nothing to do with procurement.

title: Salesforce Data Cloud Analyst
description: Join one of the nation’s most comprehensive academic medical centers, UChicago Medicine as a Salesforce Data Cloud Analyst in our Marketing Department . This is a remote, work from home opportunity and you may be based outside of the greater Chicagoland area. Job Summary: The Salesforce Data Cloud Analyst will serve as the main subject matter expert of marketing audience segmentation and data connections and management. This role will report to the Executive Director, Performance Marketing, and have a key role in serving as the liaison between multiple internal and external stakeholders (marketing, agency, consultants, etc.). This role will need to have experience in working with digital media tagging and Customer Data Platforms. Essential Job Functions: Lead audience activation management, processes, evolution, and oversee data taxonomy creation, set up and measurement Collaborate with media partners to configure, test, and validate destinations (social, display, rich media, targeting platforms) to send segments for audience activation Influence internal teams and take a leadership role to ensure that key audience segmentations are used appropriately and regularly Be the subject matter expert in audience data management and insights - build a learning agenda to evangelize audience management best practices and educate marketers Qualifications: 8+ years of experience in a combination of marketing, digital marketing, digital platforms, or media Seasoned experience with Data Management Platforms, Customer Data Platforms, and Programmatic Platforms to create attributes, segments, push audiences live, and prepare audience analysis Strong familiarity with digital advertising ecosystems Strong familiarity with Salesforce Marketing Cloud and Data Cloud Strong familiarity with Adobe Customer Journey Analytics Position Details: Job Type/FTE: Full Time (1.0 FTE) Shift: Day Unit/Department: Marketing – Hyde Park CBA Code: Non-Union Must comply with UCMC’s COVID-19 Vaccination requirement as a condition of employment. If you have already received the vaccination, you must provide proof as part of the pre-employment process. This is in addition to your compliance with the Flu Vaccination requirement as well. Medical and religious exemptions will be considered consistent with applicable law. Lastly, a pre-employment physical, drug screening, and background check are also required for all employees prior to hire.

title: Data Center and Security Engineer
description: Job description: Your mission: The Data Center and Security Engineer will be responsible for providing support in the data center and working with the cyber security team. The successful candidate will have experience and is eager to learn more about how to manage the server and cyber security. Responsibilities: Design, install, configure, and maintain data center infrastructure for industrial and enterprise applications. Monitor and maintain data center environments and operations, including server hardware, software, and associated infrastructure. Ensure the quality of data backups and perform regular tests to ensure data consistency. Manage IT and OT data center Incident. Work with vendors and external support teams to resolve technical issues. Process regular vulnerability scans and prepare a mitigation plan for server and network infrastructure. Perform risk assessments for software and OT server infrastructure. Collaborate with other engineers, technicians, and stakeholders to ensure datacenter availability, reliability, and compliance. Support the integration of OT systems and devices with IT server infrastructure and applications. Provide technical guidance and training to end-users and junior staff on cyber security and related topics. Supports IT/OT audits and participates in internal and external audits. Respond to security breaches and support post-event analyses. Adhere to company policies and procedures regarding change management and compliance regulations. Your profile: Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, or related field, or equivalent work experience. At least 3 years of experience in a data center administration, or support role, preferably in industrial settings. Strong knowledge of server architecture and understanding of virtualization technologies and windows operating systems. Good knowledge about VMware and windows server operating systems. Working knowledge and understanding of manufacturing operations, production and computer data collection systems. Ability to troubleshoot complex data center issues and provide effective solutions. Interest in all aspects of cyber security research and development. Ability to work independently and without the need for supervision, as well as collaboratively within the team and across various IT groups and business units. Good communication, documentation, and interpersonal skills. We offer: Our offer: · Benefits first of the month following hire date. · 401k Retirement Savings Plan with match. Do you want to know more about Mondi? Mondi is a global leader in packaging and paper with over 100,000 customised innovative solutions that are sustainable by design: Paper where possible, plastic when useful. Our group employs around 21,000 people in more than 100 operations in over 30 countries. Diversity is our advantage. We strive to build a team that reflects the diversity of the world we work in and encourage applications from traditionally underrepresented groups such as women, visible minorities, people identifying as LGBTQ+, and people with disabilities. title: Senior Data Engineer
description: At IMO Health, we are a team of dedicated clinical terminologists, data scientists, industry subject matter experts, and informaticists who helped facilitate the evolution from analogue to digital capture of clinical events, the precise code-mapping that simplifies complex workflows, and the translation of unstructured into structured data. We “wrote the digital dictionary” used in every major EHR, and we are leveraging clinical AI to generate insights that expand and deepen our impact across the healthcare ecosystem. We are currently in need of a Senior Data Engineer to join this team! The hire will be responsible for expanding and optimizing our data and data pipeline architecture, as well as optimizing data flow and collection for cross-functional teams. The ideal candidate is an experienced data pipeline builder and data wrangler who enjoys optimizing data systems and building them from the ground up. The Senior Data Engineer will support our software developers, database architects, data analysts, and data scientists on data initiatives and will ensure optimal data delivery architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects. They must be self-directed and comfortable supporting the data needs of multiple teams, systems and products. The right candidate will be excited by the prospect of optimizing or even re-designing our company’s data architecture to support our next generation of products and data initiatives. Join our growing Software Engineering department as a Data Engineer to help design, create, and support high quality solutions that support 80% of US clinicians and build the application of Data Engineering within IMO Health! What You'll Do Create and maintain optimal data pipeline architecture Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and AWS ‘big data’ technologies Build analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into customer acquisition, operational efficiency, and other key business performance metrics Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data, and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs Keep our data separated and secure across national boundaries through multiple data centers and AWS regions Create data tools for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems What You'll Need Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems, or another quantitative field Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases Experience building and optimizing ‘big data’ data pipelines, architectures and data sets Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency, and workload management A successful history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large disconnected datasets Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, and highly scalable ‘big data’ data stores Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment Experience with big data tools: Spark, Kafka, etc Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases, including PostgreSQL and ElasticSearch Experience with data pipeline and workflow management tools: Azkaban, Luigi, Airflow, etc Experience with AWS cloud services: EC2, EMR, RDS, Redshift Experience with stream-processing systems: Storm, Spark-Streaming, etc Experience with object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python, Java, C++, Scala, etc What We'll Give You The space to be innovative and collaborative with your peers and team members. Training from the best. Collectively, we’ve got years of expertise in Healthcare and IT. Part of a tight-knit team that supports each other, challenges each other, and is looking to make a significant impact in the industry. Excellent benefits package, including competitive benefits through multiple health, dental, and vision plans, 100% company match up to 5% contribution on your 401(k), flexible PTO and hours, peak performance club trips, and more!

title: Supply Chain Business Analytics Analyst III
description: Address: USA-IL-Chicago-300 South Riverside Plaza Store Code: Services (5120697) ADUSA Procurement is a partner company to Ahold Delhaize USA, providing supply chain services that support the delivery of products from a supplier to the warehouse. ADUSA Procurement is part of the Ahold Delhaize USA family of brands, which also includes five leading omnichannel grocery brands – Food Lion, Giant Food, The GIANT Company, Hannaford and Stop & Shop. Position Summary The supply chain business analyst will work collaboratively with the supply chain product managers, supply chain engineers, and the operational teams to develop reporting, dashboarding, and analytical solutions to ad-hoc supply chain problems. This role can tell stories with data and simplify and present the relevant information to help our supply chain operations teams make informed, data-driven solution. This includes but is not limited to the development of a robust vendor scorecard and operational playbook to drive incremental value in vendor negotiations. Develop business models and assumptions for financial models and analysis to unlock value. Provide recommendations based on data and provide options to inform leadership decision making. Principle Duties & Responsibilities Leads relationships with multiple stakeholders to define metrics and create operational performance reporting and dashboarding for supply chain teams. Supports supply chain through all internal collaborative channels as the data expert for the supply chain analytics reporting environment and help users create dashboards and reporting for their business needs Leads the development and execution of training, support, and troubleshooting for analytics environment Provides analytical support, dashboard maintenance and reports to identify business opportunities to unlock the values Supports collaboration with strategy group and key cross-functional leadership to support decisions and evaluate potential strategic opportunities, with a focus on providing recommendations on improvement for strategic tests and initiatives underway. Supports the partnership with finance and IT and relevant leaders to develop meaningful assumptions for financial models (including any pro forma investment models) regarding impacts of major strategic initiative Develop presentations utilized to communicate meaningful results, trends, and insights regarding the performance of key strategic initiatives. Leads strategic projects, creating structure around ambiguous strategic questions, analyzing complex business problems, and developing data driven insights to support a solution Basic Requirements Bachelor's Degree in business, economics, engineering, math, statistics, or other quantitatively oriented major; Master's Degree in similar quantitative field preferred 3-6 Years experience 1-2 years of experience with Microsoft Power BI, Tableau and other Visualization tools Knowledge Deep understanding of, and experience applying, the following ML concepts Database and SQL knowledge, Python, R, SAS, Power Bi Knowledge of model management Supply Chain experience a plus Skills And Abilities Advanced capabilities in Microsoft Office; Mastery of Excel and PowerPoint; Expertise in Microsoft Azure, PowerBI, and SQL Significant experience with analytics, statistics and structured problem solving Knowledge of approaches to work with big data, including querying databases and manipulating large sets of data to generate robust insights Ability to develop a structured approach to complex questions and quickly form a hypothesis against which to run test analyses Experience with Microsoft Azure stack, Hadoop, Hive clusters, Apache Spark, Databricks Our flexible/ hybrid work schedule includes 3 in-person days at one of our core locations and 2 remote days. At Ahold Delhaize USA, we value Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging (DEI&B). Our employees and prospective employees are treated with respect and dignity. As an equal opportunity employer, we comply with all applicable federal, state and local laws. Qualified applicants are considered without regard to sex, race, color, ancestry, national origin, citizenship status, religion, age, marital status (including civil unions), military service, veteran status, pregnancy (including childbirth and related medical conditions), genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, legally recognized disability, domestic violence victim status or any other characteristic protected by law. We provide reasonable accommodations to applicants and employees with disabilities. If you have a disability and require assistance in the application process, please contact our Talent Acquisition Department at tad@adusa.com. For more information, visit www.adusa.com. title: IT Business Analyst
description: About Us Champro® is a privately-owned sporting goods and apparel manufacturer that has been in business for 30+ years. We deliver high-value, traditional & innovative athletic equipment and apparel via outstanding, integrity-driven customer service. Our business philosophy is focused on our customers and we take pride in providing them with the best overall values in team sports products. Position We are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Business Analyst (BA) to join our dynamic team. The BA will play a crucial role in ensuring clear and comprehensive business requirements, facilitating effective communication with stakeholders, and enabling our product and development teams to deliver business value predictably and consistently. U.S Citizenship required. Requirements U.S. Citizenship Understand and proficiently navigate the software development lifecycle (SDLC). Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and development teams, ensuring clear and effective communication. Proactively anticipate and assess the needs of customers and business stakeholders to identify solutions and opportunities. Collaborate closely with product managers, end-users, and other stakeholders to gather detailed business and technical requirements. Make independent recommendations and system improvements based on stakeholder feedback and analysis. Translate business needs into clear, actionable requirements documentation. Create detailed and accurate tickets for the development team, ensuring clarity and completeness. Conduct meetings with stakeholders to solicit, analyze, and document requirements, obtaining necessary sign-offs. Collaborate with developers and stakeholders to refine and elaborate on ticket details as required. Conduct walkthroughs with the development team to facilitate smooth handoff and alignment. Support the development team throughout the SDLC stages, including technical design, coding, testing, and implementation. Perform testing to ensure deliverables meet business acceptance criteria. Facilitate stakeholder meetings to provide progress updates, gather feedback, prioritize work, and demonstrate upcoming releases. Manage multiple priorities and stakeholder expectations effectively. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related discipline. 3-5 years of experience as a Business Analyst in software projects throughout the entire development cycle. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with a proven ability to collaborate effectively across business, operations, and technology teams. Previous experience in Quality Assurance is preferred. Proficiency in eliciting requirements and conducting testing. Strong ability to develop and maintain documentation for policies, procedures, and best practices. Solid understanding of SDLC and Agile methodologies. Exceptional analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills. Attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality work. Ability to remain calm and professional during challenging discussions. Experience with visual modeling, process mapping, and process improvement tools such as Miro, Visio, or Azure DevOps is a plus. Strong interpersonal skills for building rapport with diverse stakeholders. Company Culture We are proud to offer eligible associates a full-range of benefits including medical, dental, vision and life insurance, as well as short-term and long-term disability, 401K, Profit Sharing, paid time off, holidays, and reimbursement toward gym membership fees. A collaborative atmosphere working together to exceed our customers’ expectations, as well as, an Equal Opportunity Employer bringing together diverse individuals to develop new and innovative solutions Compensation: From $95,000.00 to $105,000.00 per year

title: Sr Lead Data Engineer
description: Position Overview Navistar is not just building trucks - it's forging the future of mobility. As a global industry pioneer, Navistar is assembling a team of makers, problem solvers, and future world builders. Together, we are not just imagining a better world - We're shaping it, one innovative solution at a time. Join Navistar now and be a part of the journey towards a brighter, more connected tomorrow. We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Sr Lead Data Engineer to join our Digital Solutions Team. As a Sr. Lead Data Engineer, you will design, develop, and operationalize the MDM platform which includes building data pipelines to integrate data sources to MDM Platform, tuning matching algorithms and developing APIs to enable master data consumption. This is a hybrid position based three days per week at our headquarters in Lisle, Illinois. Responsibilities Design, develop, optimize, and maintain data pipelines, storage, and compute components using Azure Services Collaborate with cross-functional teams to collect and review MDM requirements and translate them into technical design documents. Perform data analysis and profiling using Collibra data quality platform to support Data Governance initiatives. Foster a culture of sharing, re-use, design for scale, stability, and operational efficiency of data and analytical solutions. Partner with Enterprise Architecture to develop detailed design documents that would be leveraged for development Minimum Requirements Bachelor’s degree At least 8 years of data quality and/or data engineering and/or analytics or statistical analysis experience At least 1 year of experience leading cross functional teams/projects OR Master’s degree At least 6 years of data quality and/or data engineering and/or analytics or statistical analysis experience At least 1 year of experience leading cross functional teams/projects OR At least 10 years of data quality and/or data engineering and/or analytics or statistical analysis experience At least 1 year of experience leading cross functional teams/projects Desired Skills Hands-on experience with MDM tools like Informatica (IDMC/IICS), Reltio or Stibo STEP platform Solid knowledge of data integration patterns, data matching techniques Strong proficiency in PLSQL, Spark, PySpark, Python and Pandas Hands-on experience in Azure Data Factory or Informatica Power center and any data quality tool (Informatica or Talend DQ, Trilium or Ataccama) Experience with DevOps tools like Azure DevOps or Jenkins Exceptional communication and collaboration skills to understand business partner needs and deliver solutions Intellectual curiosity to understand and answer questions Intellectual humility to leverage the expertise of others Exemplary organizational skills with attention to detail & accuracy Openness to working in agile environments with multiple stakeholders. Professional attitude and service orientation; team player Good communication and collaboration skills Company Overview Navistar, Inc. (“Navistar”) is a purpose-driven company, reimagining how to deliver what matters to create more cohesive relationships, build higher-performing teams and find solutions where others don’t. Based in Lisle, Illinois, Navistar or its subsidiaries and affiliates produce International® brand commercial trucks and engines, IC Bus® brand school and commercial buses, all-makes OnCommand® Connection advanced connectivity services, and Fleetrite®, ReNEWeD® and Diamond Advantage® brand aftermarket parts. With a history of innovation dating back to 1831, Navistar has more than 14,500 employees worldwide and is part of TRATON SE, a global champion of the truck and transport services industry. Additional information is available at www.Navistar.com. title: Salesforce Test Engineer (W2)
description: Responsibilities: Contribute in all aspects of SDLC process( SCRUM, Design, Code, Test, Deploy & Maintain) Collaborate with Salesforce Product, UX and Engineering teams Review and analyze business and system requirements / specifications Design test plans, scenarios, scripts, and procedures Execute test cases (manual or automated) and log test results Work with the development and product team to correct bugs / errors and identify requirement updates / clarifications Contribute to code review process to improve code quality Develop and maintain automation frameworks and solutions for Salesforce product and APIs Automate tests to facilitate regression testing Collaborate with engineering to build solutions on testing and automation to achieve SecDevOps best practices Other duties as assigned. title: Systems Analyst
description: Job Description Senior Systems Analyst Description As the Senior Systems Analyst, you will serve as the primary expert on Oracle JD Edwards Enterprise One, providing user support and managing related IT systems. This role involves training users on new functionalities, processes, and systems. You will contribute to the implementation of Oracle JD Edwards Enterprise One updates, handling testing and supporting all project requirements. The Senior Systems Analyst will also design and document workflows, offering recommendations to enhance operational effectiveness. Taking on the role of Project Manager, you will lead key projects by developing and maintaining project plans for new system implementations, programs, updates, and modifications. Responsibilities Analyze and oversee assigned projects, interpreting business needs and translating them into functional and operational requirements. Direct the preparation and installation of systems and procedures, including designing source documents, providing technical guidance for operations, and determining the format for management reports. Collaborate with various business units to quickly comprehend business issues, and define project concepts, objectives, and approaches. Demonstrate proficiency in JD Edwards Enterprise One Development Toolset, particularly the Object Management Workbench (OMW). Offer technical support and mentorship on JD Edwards Enterprise One modules and tools to other MIS staff. Perform programming, database, and system design tasks. Identify industry best practices when addressing business problems. Take on leadership roles and take ownership of projects. Develop relationships with key business users, fostering a collaborative environment with business units. Communicate effectively with clients to identify needs and evaluate alternative business solutions with project management. Seek continuous opportunities to enhance customer satisfaction and deepen client relationships. Effectively manage client expectations. Propose areas for improvement in internal processes, providing potential solutions. Make sound decisions under pressure and think analytically. Gather and interpret relevant data and information. Direct the preparation and installation of systems and procedures, including the final installation. Perform additional duties as assigned. Qualifications Requirements : Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field. Minimum of 5 years of experience as a Systems Analyst. At least 5 years of hands-on experience with Oracle JD Edwards Enterprise One 9.2. Minimum of 5 years of experience with JD Edwards OMW (Object Management Workbench) toolset. Familiarity with JD Edwards Enterprise One CNC is advantageous but not mandatory. Knowledge in JD Edwards Enterprise One modules, including Finance, Distribution, Inventory & Manufacturing. Why Is This a Great Opportunity Job Title: Senior Systems Analyst Job Location: Highland, IL Job Type: Full-Time(100% onsite) only US Citizens Salary Type : Annual Salary Salary Min : $ 85000 Salary Max : $ 140000 Currency Type : USD

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description: About Us We are a dynamic team that manages a Business Intelligence product for our logistics customers and creates/explores new Business Intelligence concepts for data driven decision making with our internal business teams. As an experienced Business Intelligence Developer, you are confident applying data engineering principles to your projects regardless of the desired codebase all the while having an eye for process automation. title: Supply Chain Business Analytics Analyst IV
description: Address: USA-IL-Chicago-300 South Riverside Plaza Store Code: Services (5120697) Ahold Delhaize USA, a division of global food retailer Ahold Delhaize, is part of the U.S. family of brands, which also includes five leading omnichannel grocery brands – Food Lion, Giant Food, The GIANT Company, Hannaford and Stop & Shop. Ahold Delhaize USA associates support the brands with a wide range of services, including Finance, Legal, Sustainability, Commercial, Digital and E-commerce, Technology and more. Position Summary The supply chain business analyst will work collaboratively with the supply chain product managers, supply chain engineers, and the operational teams to develop reporting, dashboarding, and analytical solutions to ad-hoc supply chain problems. This role can tell stories with data and simplify and present the relevant information to help our supply chain operations teams make informed, data-driven solutions. This includes but is not limited to the development of robust reports and operational playbook to drive incremental value in business stakeholder conversations and vendor negotiations. Develop business models and assumptions for financial models and analysis to unlock value. Provide recommendations based on data and provide options to inform leadership decision making. Our flexible/ hybrid work schedule includes 3 in-person days at one of our core locations and 2 remote days. Principle Duties & Responsibilities Drives relationships with multiple stakeholders to define metrics and create operational performance reporting and dashboarding for supply chain teams. Represents supply chain through all internal collaborative channels as the data expert for the supply chain analytics reporting environment and help users create dashboards and reporting for their business need Mentor Supply Chain COOPs by providing project oversight, guidance, and development Leads the development and execution of training, support, and troubleshooting for analytics environment Leads the retrieval and quality control of data related to financial, merchandising, shopper marketing, e-commerce, and supply chain revenue to ensure the data accuracy. Builds the supporting business process for analytical support, dashboard maintenance and reports to identify business opportunities to unlock the values Collaborate closely with the strategy group and key cross-functional leadership to support decisions and evaluate potential strategic opportunities, with a focus on providing recommendations on improvement for strategic tests and initiatives underway. Leads the partnership with finance and IT and relevant leaders to develop meaningful assumptions for financial models (including any pro forma investment models) regarding impacts of major strategic initiatives Develop presentations utilized to communicate meaningful results, trends, and insights regarding the performance of key strategic initiatives. Drives strategic projects, creating structure around ambiguous strategic questions, analyzing complex business problems, and developing data driven insights to support a solution Lead and engage in discussions with leadership about innovative approaches to analysis and the implications of different data, while building alignment on the results. Supports overall IT relationships, budgeting process, prioritization, and resource allocation in collaboration with IT leads and analytics product managers Basic Requirements Bachelor's Degree in business, economics, engineering, math, statistics, or other quantitatively oriented major; Master's Degree in similar quantitative field preferred 5-8 years relevant work experience Supply Chain experience is a plus Skills & Ablities Advanced capabilities in Microsoft Office; Mastery of PowerBI, Excel and PowerPoint; Expertise in Microsoft Azure Database and SQL knowledge, Python, R, SAS Significant experience with analytics, statistics and structured problem solving Strong oral and written communication skills and confidence sharing strategic analytics with senior leaders Ability to challenge conventional thinking to deliver innovative recommendations Advanced capabilities in Microsoft Office; Mastery of Excel and PowerPoint; Expertise in Microsoft Azure, PowerBI, Python, R and SQL Experience with Microsoft Azure stack, Hadoop, Hive clusters, Apache Spark, Databricks Ahold Delhaize USA, a division of global food retailer Ahold Delhaize, is part of the U.S. family of brands, which also includes five leading omnichannel grocery brands – Food Lion, Giant Food, The GIANT Company, Hannaford and Stop & Shop. When considered together, the companies of Ahold Delhaize USA comprise the largest grocery retail group on the East Coast and the fourth largest grocery retail group in the nation, serving millions of omnichannel customers each week. title: Staff Systems Engineer
description: About Flexport: At Flexport, we believe global trade can move the human race forward. That’s why it’s our mission to make global commerce so easy there will be more of it. We’re shaping the future of a $8.6T industry with solutions powered by innovative technology and exceptional people. Today, companies of all sizes - from emerging brands to Fortune 500s - use Flexport technology to move more than $19B of merchandise across 112 countries a year. The recent global supply chain crisis has put Flexport center stage as we continue to play a pivotal role in how goods move around the world. At a valuation of $8 billion, we’re experiencing record growth and are proud to have the support of the best investors in the game who believe in our mission, solutions and people. Ready to tackle global challenges that impact business, society, and the environment? Come join us. The opportunity: Flexport IT is looking for a Staff Systems engineer with a focus on Identity and Access Management (IAM) Engineer. In this role, you are responsible for designing, implementing, and administering IAM solutions to ensure the secure and efficient management of user identities and access privileges. The candidate will have broad knowledge across IT services with in-depth hands on working knowledge in supporting one or more of the following additional services: Google Workspace, Slack, MS O365, Jira and Confluence, user endpoint device deployment and management (Jamf and MS InTune). Your expertise will be critical in automating workflows, protecting sensitive systems and data, mitigating security risks, and maintaining compliance. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to develop and deploy IAM strategies, lead IT engineering projects, and provide technical leadership. You will: Design, implement, and maintain the end to end lifecycle of Identity and Access management. Drive solutions and project work. Administer IAM technologies and platforms including Okta, directory services, MFA, password management. Administer a range of SaaS applications including Google Workspace, O365, Slack, Jira/Confluence. Administer fleet of Mac and Windows devices using Jamf and InTune. Automate workflows around provisioning, deprovisioning, and application access. Establish and maintain identity governance processes, including role-based access control (RBAC), entitlement reviews, and access certification. Onboard new applications for single sign-on. Develop and maintain technical operating procedures, policies, and engineering roadmaps. Work closely with the Security team to ensure the platform is designed and implemented with security best practices. Mentor junior staff members. Provide operations support. You should have: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field (or comparable experience). 7+ years of experience in Identity and Access Management (IAM) systems engineering and broad management of various IT services. In-depth knowledge of IAM concepts and protocols, such as IGA, RBAC, MFA, LDAP, SAML, SCIM, OAuth. Strong hands-on experience with IAM tools and platforms, such as Okta and directory services. Scripting and automation experience Working knowledge of SaaS / collaboration tools: Google Workspace, Slack, Jira/Confluence, O365 Experienced in managing Mac and Windows devices with Jamf and InTune. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Strong problem-solving and analytical skills. A "compliance first" attitude to keep our regulators happy and enthusiastic about Flexport since we operate in a heavily regulated industry. Worried about not having any logistics experience? Don’t be! Our mission is to make global trade easy for everyone. That’s why it’s important to bring people from diverse backgrounds and experiences together with our industry veterans to help move the global logistics industry forward. We know this industry is complex. That’s why we invest in education starting day one with Flexport Academy, a one week intensive onboarding program designed specifically to set every new Flexport employee up for success. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across all US locations. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. Within the range displayed, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education and / or training. The US base salary range for this position: (exclusive of bonus, equity and benefits.) $120,240 - $178,067 USD At Flexport, our ability to fulfill our mission of making global commerce easy and accessible relies on having a diverse, dedicated and engaged workforce. That is why Flexport is committed to creating and nurturing an environment where anyone can be their authentic self. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, physical and mental disability, health status, marital and family status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, military and veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law. per year
