title: Clinical Data Analyst
description: Job Title - Clinical Data Analyst Type - Onsite LinkedIn must be updated and local to CA Overall 5 yrs consultant and as a clinical data analyst 2-3 will be fine Description - Reporting And Data Analysis Extracts and integrates healthcare and operations data from multiple sources, reviews and creates datasets, and prepares analysis and reports based on customer requirements. Visualizes data using charts, graphs, tables, and summaries to support use and understanding. Applies quality assurance processes to ensure data is methodologically and statistically sound and accurate. Identifies and resolves potential issues with analysis assumptions and data quality or escalates as needed. Analyzes and compares data to benchmarks and standards for clinical, operational, and financial measures, and provides summaries of the organization’s performance. Abstracts, validates, and submits data elements to external agencies to support compliance with regulatory reporting. Data/System Management Monitors for incorrect/incomplete data, executing quality assurance processes to ensure data integrity and accuracy of data, reports, and presentation materials. Identifies data gaps. Works with users, system office, and/or vendors to create, modify, and define data structures and dictionaries. Coordinates and supports data transfers/interfaces, ensuring correct mapping and alignment with system standards. Collaborates with the system office for application changes, upgrades, and enhancements, performing necessary testing to assure the functionality and integrity of reporting solutions. Quality Projects Collects quality and performance data, providing data and analysis to support performance measurement, quality outcomes management, planning projects, and audits. Supports the development of metrics and/or performance/quality measures. Applies innovative techniques and processes for measuring, monitoring, analyzing, and reporting on healthcare processes, outcomes, and costs. Technical Support Presents data and analysis to operational and medical leaders and staff, describing and explaining data and results. Trains less-experienced staff in data retrieval techniques, statistical analysis, and/or data visualization methods. Serves as a resource and super-user, assisting end-users with the use of database applications and presentation of data. Develops customized templates and formats. Performance Management And Continuous Improvement Seeks and responds to regular performance feedback. Supports and assists the team when necessary. Contributes ideas and actions toward continuous improvement of processes and workflows. Recognizes and communicates potential issues to the appropriate leader. Education Equivalent experience will be accepted in lieu of the required degree or diploma. Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems Management, Mathematics, Statistics, Business or Healthcare Management, or a related field, or equivalent education/experience. Typical Experience 2 years of recent relevant experience. Skills And Knowledge General knowledge and understanding of Quality Management, Infection Control, Risk Management, regulatory compliance, and general hospital/clinical operations and processes. Understanding of the use and application of quality measures and outcomes. Knowledge of various data sources available for quality management reporting and analysis. Familiarity with medical/clinical terminologies and clinical data. Understanding of quality performance/process improvement methodologies (e.g., Lean/Six Sigma, PDSA, Rapid Cycle). Technical skills to integrate data/information to produce reports according to user requirements and specifications. Critical thinking and analytical skills with a keen attention to detail. Ability to compute and apply moderately complex mathematical and statistical calculations. Displays a customer service focus in all decisions and actions. Organizational skills to effectively manage and re-prioritize activities and projects to meet deadlines while maintaining a high degree of responsiveness. Ability to communicate through verbal and written means, especially when helping customers understand technical concepts and data. Ability to interact and maintain effective working relationships with those contacted in the performance of required duties. Demonstrates respect for cultural and linguistic differences and promotes an inclusive work environment. Ability to work effectively in a dynamic and fast-paced environment with changing business priorities. Demonstrates initiative in providing feedback/input to improve workflow/processes. Ability to maintain and work discreetly with confidential information. Ability to use essential applications and databases associated with the role’s duties and responsibilities.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description: Primary Responsibilities: Creating interactive and user-friendly dashboards, reports, data models, and datasets. Developing and administering Power BI reports and SharePoint sites. Capable of working independently and collaboratively with cross-departmental team members to collect insights and disseminate reports and documentation. Possessing strong reporting and communication skills to succinctly present insights. Conducting critical analysis of data sets and reporting findings, including insights and discrepancies. Formulating and executing Transition Plans to facilitate a seamless transfer of responsibilities from project initiatives to ongoing operations. Experience Level: Minimum of 4 years – looking for a super user of Power BI. Tableau experience a plus though not required. Qualifications: This role requires extensive knowledge and expertise in business intelligence, databases, and all aspects of BI tools – specific to Power BI The position requires knowledge of Microsoft SQL database, SharePoint, Microsoft Access, Microsoft Excel, SQL and understanding relational databases This position also requires documentation experience, attention to detail, and communicating effectively across a wide range of business and technical stakeholders across all job levels Experience collecting user requirements and ability to understand complex business needs then translate them into BI application solutions Expert knowledge of Data Management, Business Intelligence and Analytics concepts

title: Sr. BI Analyst
description: About The Company Albertsons Companies is at the forefront of the revolution in retail. With a fixation on raising the bar with innovation and building belonging through our culture, our team is rallying our company around a unique purpose : to create joy around each table and inspire a healthier tomorrow for every community. Albertsons Companies is one of the largest food and drug retailers in the United States, with over 2,200 stores in 34 states and the District of Columbia. Our well-known banners include Albertsons, Safeway, Vons, Jewel-Osco, Shaw's, Acme, Tom Thumb, Randalls, United Supermarkets, Pavilions, Star Market, Haggen, Carrs, Kings Food Markets, and Balducci's Food Lovers Market. We support our stores with 22 distribution centers and 19 manufacturing plants. Placing a premium on adaptability, safety and family well-being, our work model, Presence with a Purpose, offers a hybrid work environment between remote work and office time. A one-size-fits-all approach does not apply to everyone, and teams are empowered to make decisions best for them. Bring your flavor Building the future of food and well-being starts with you. Join our team and bring your best self to the table. #bringyourflavor What You Will Be Doing The Own Brands Strategic Sourcing Department has an opening for a Sr. BI Analyst. The position will be based in Pleasanton, CA or Boise, ID, or one of our main regional offices (Seattle, WA, Portland, OR, Denver, CO, Dallas, TX, Chicago, IL, Fullerton, CA, or Phoenix, AZ). The BI Analyst is responsible for delivering business solutions that collect, transform, analyze, and interpret data to draw key insights to support Strategic Sourcing in making an informed data-based and strategic decisions on category review and negotiations. Has a keen ability to extract data from a variety of sources across the Albertsons enterprise and use quantitative skill set to create dashboards, reports, metrics using a variety of business intelligence tools, techniques, and technology. This individual must have a unique combination of technical and business operations acumen and experience, coupled with strong emotional intelligence. Main Responsibilities Partner with Own Brands Strategic Sourcing Team with business needs and provide solutions for data insights. Analyze large and complex data sets and create optimized solutions to present actionable recommendations to Sourcing Managers. Ability to take data with different ranges of complexity level from disparate sources across the enterprise and synthesize into meaningful business insights for Sourcing Managers. Provide in-depth analytical support for a variety of sourcing initiatives including category reviews, new item cost analysis, and logistic assessments. Aggregate data from RFI/RFP submissions and help create a decision matrix. Prepare and present analytics results and recommendations to leaders by building visual charts, graphs, and process flows. Create ad-hoc customized reports for a variety of needs/functions through platforms such as Power BI dashboard. Lead creating training content for Strategic Sourcing Team such as excel tips and tricks. Mentor BI Analysts. The salary range is $82,900 to $115,000 annually. Starting salary will vary based on criteria such as location, experience, and qualifications. There may be flexibility for exceptional candidates. Benefits may include medical, dental, vision, disability and life insurance, sick pay (accrued based on hours worked), PTO/Vacation Pay (accrued based on hours worked) or Flexible Time Off, paid holidays (8-9 days annually), bereavement pay, and retirement benefits (such as 401(k) eligibility). title: Data Analyst, eCommerce Analytics
description: Tailored Brands, Inc. is a leading omni-channel specialty retailer of menswear, including suits and a broad selection of business casual offerings as well as the largest provider of tuxedo rental products in the U.S. and Canada. We operate retail stores in all 50 states and Canada. Our U.S. retail stores are operated under the brand names of Men’s Wearhouse, Jos. A. Bank, Men’s Wearhouse and Tux, and K&G Fashion. Our Canadian stores are operated under the brand name of Moores in ten provinces. Our purpose is we help people love the way they look and feel for their most important moments. We accomplish this by putting customers at the center of every decision, rallying together to achieve common goals, and striving for excellence and continuous improvement. We help fulfill this purpose by valuing differences and knowing they make us better and showing up with courage to always do the right thing. If you want to make a difference, be part of a great team and grow, you might be a perfect fit. About The Job We currently have an exciting opportunity for an Data Analyst, Ecommerce Analytics to join the Tailored Brands Enterprise Analytics team. As a Ecommerce Data Analyst, your primary responsibility will be to extract actionable insights from data to optimize ecommerce performance with insights from site content, promotions, customer behavioral data, marketing strategies, and market data, just to name a few. You will collaborate with ecommerce product management, category management, and site operations teams to drive data-driven decisions. The primary goal is providing insights for the ecommerce and marketing teams to guide, monitor and measure their strategies. What You’ll Do | Key Accountabilities Data Collection: Partner with operations to track customer actions on the website through Google Tag Manager and Google Analytics. Data Analysis: Dive deep into customer behavior data in Google Analytics, sales data in Snowflake, and aggregated data in Tableau dashboards to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities to increase conversion, average order value, and traffic. Reporting: Create clear, concise, and insightful dashboards via Tableau, Looker Studio, and Excel Pivots. Presentations: Present analyses in a clear, interpretable, and applicable way that can be shared widely, communicating effectively with both technical and non-technical partners. Collaborate: Partner with data engineering, ecommerce teams, and across analytics to share learnings, align on methodologies and leverage best practices. What You’ll Bring | Skills & Experience Bachelor’s degree in statistics, business, merchandising, or a related field is required. Minimum of 3 years career experience in ecommerce. Google Analytics: Proficiency in analyzing data in GA is required. SQL: Proficiency in querying databases for data extraction is required. Tableau or Power BI: Experience visualizing insights effectively is required. Please note that you do not need to qualify for all requirements to be considered. We encourage you to apply if you can meet most of the requirements and are comfortable opening a dialog to be considered. Work Environment, Physical & Mental Demands Ability to sit and work at a computer keyboard for extended periods of time. Must utilize visual acuity, speech and hearing, hand and eye coordination and manual dexterity necessary to operate a computer and office equipment. Hours regularly 40 hours per week, as work dictates, from a remote office location. Benefits This role is eligible for healthcare including medical, dental and vision, retirement savings (401k with a company match), income protection programs such as life, accident and disability insurance, paid time off for sick leave, vacation, bereavement, jury duty, and holidays, wellbeing program, commuter, adoption assistance, education assistance, legal services, and employee merchandise discounts. For more detailed information go to mytbtotalrewards.com. Work-Life Balance Responsibilities We understand the demands of work, school, family, and personal responsibilities. Through our work-life resources and programs we offer services for every stage of life to help you manage the day-to-day needs. We offer programs such as: Meeting-Free Fridays (encouraged) | so you can catch up on work and self-development. Summer Fridays | from Memorial Day to Labor Day so you can enjoy a head-start to the weekend. Holiday Early Departure | close out early the business day before a company observed holiday. The starting salary for this position is $70,200 - $107,200 and may increase to $146,300 depending on merit, length of service with the Company, and other factors. We take into consideration an individual’s skills, background, and experience in determining final salary. Base pay information is based on market location and may be subject to prevailing wage laws, if applicable. Note: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required and are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities or qualifications associated with this job. Work Locations: 02098 Corporate Remote 5601 Arnold Rd., Suite 200 Dublin 94568 Job: Strategy & Analytics Organization: Tailored Shared Services Shift: Day Job

title: Data Analyst with P&C Domain
description: ROLE TITLE Production Support Data Analyst with P&C Domain (Mandatory) ROLE LOCATION(S) Onshore – Day 1 Onsite Hybrid (3 Days/ Week) Boston, MA; Charlotte, NC; Colorado Springs, CO; Conshohocken, PA; Dallas, TX; Fargo, ND; Florham Park, NJ; Garden City, NY; Houston, TX; Jacksonville, IL; Lenexa, KS; Los Angeles, CA; Lubbock, TX; Mt Juliet, TN; New York, NY; Purchase, NY; Topeka, KS TEAM Data and Business Intelligence Role Summary The Production Support Data Analyst is a hands-on position with a focus on supporting the data accuracy and completeness within the enterprise data warehouse. The position will work within IT to help Client maintain the enterprise data warehouse architecture. Furthermore, the data warehouse architecture will measure performance in all aspects of the organization’s operations. Role Responsibilities Work with business stakeholders and IT teams to analyze and resolve data issues for the enterprise data warehouse. Create source-to-target mapping documents to capture additional application data elements. Load the source-to-target mapping documents from source systems into the enterprise data warehouse. Collaborate with the ETL team to ensure the source-to-target mapping documents are in correct ETL code. Ensure the ETL code align with STM requirements. Perform data validation, to insure correct data movement into the enterprise data warehouse architecture. Consult with reporting teams to develop a general understanding for any identified variances – between the enterprise data warehouse and source system applications. Technical Qualifications Proven 5+ years’ experience of data analysis within an enterprise data warehouse. Possess 2 years of Policy & Claims Insurance subject-matter expertise. Candidate has advanced level SQL knowledge. Possess optimal knowledge for concepts and frameworks for Data Warehousing, ETL, and BI Architectures. Candidate is capable of creating and tuning Semantic layer Reporting Views. Able to facilitate data discovery sessions, which will include an audience of business subject-matter experts. Proven knowledge of RDBMS platforms (e.g., SQL Server, DB2), with experience in generating DDL. Possess knowledge of Guidewire Policy Center, Guidewire Claims Center, SAP FS-RI & SAP FS-CD applications with their data is considered a plus. General Qualifications Candidate has strong interpersonal skills, including both written and verbal communication skills. Possess the ability to work as part of a team. Candidate has strong organizational skills and analysis skills. Education Requirements B.S. Degree in Computer Information Science, Information Management, or Statistics. Greetings !! title: (USA) Senior, Data Analyst - Volume Forecasting
description: Position Summary... What you'll do... This position will collaborate with and support our Forecast Manager for the development of forecasts to predict volume demand from external and internal customers and support mechanisms to meet forecast accuracy targets and ongoing changes in customer need. Marketplace Seller Support is responsible for creating a trustworthy selling experience across Walmart.com by protecting customers, brands, sellers, and Walmart from fraud, counterfeit, and abuse, as well as enabling sellers and associates in providing support experience excellence and building loyalty with Walmart's marketplace sellers and customers. We value respect for individual ideas and collaborate to create a culture where team members feel empowered to contribute equally. Our unique backgrounds and perspectives strengthen our ability to achieve Walmart's mission for customers to Save Money & Live Better. As the Senior Analyst of Volume Forecasting of the Marketplace Seller Support Forecasting Team within Shared Services, you will collaborate with our current team handling the development of volume demand forecasts and share in the responsibilities for our ever-growing Marketplace Seller Support needs. This is an exciting and transformational time as we are evolving new structure and methodologies in how we service our sellers on Walmart Marketplace. Currently, our contact centers are fully-reactive support teams, but future-state may become a hybrid of Business-to-Business (B2B) proactive outreach support contact center team who also handles reactive support inquiries. You will be a team player and together be leading the business and operations teams through the transformation of our forecasting and planning model to account for multiple complexities of our service model and striving for forecast accuracy. You and your team will be collaborating closely with other cross-functional teams (finance, business development, analytics, data science, product & engineering, capacity planning, operations and program teams) across Walmart, and you will be responsible to lead the effort & evolution of creating accurate, reliable forecasts which inform downstream teams' staffing, cost, and other related deep-dive and root cause resolution approaches. In this role, you will be enabled with ownership of forecasting strategies and efficiencies, ensuring forecast accuracy within reasonable variance. You and the team will produce and analyze weekly results, trends, and provide valuable insights for operational staffing and costs to meet target service levels. You'll Sweep Us Off Your Feet If You Are A self-starter who understands the current and future business needs by working closely with stakeholders and operations teams to recognize their needs and requirements. An experienced forecasting analyst who will develop long-term forecasts while understanding underlying volume drivers and trends. A leadership mindset with hands-on experience who shares a passion for our business, its objectives, and guides decisions with their team using their process & implementation expertise. Proactive in identifying trends, risks which may result in critical business impact, and driving root-cause analysis to identify opportunities & recommendations. Tenacious about achieving results, and thrives in a fast-paced, ever-evolving environment where strategic & operational activities must be driven seamlessly in parallel with one another. Able to think strategically & creatively to concisely set expectations to a variety of audiences (frontline associates up through leadership.) Comfortable taking calculated, data-driven risks and using learnings to continue to pivot, evolve forecasting approaches, by line of business or type of work, to achieve minimum variance to actual delivered volumes. Lives our Walmart Core Values: Respect for the Individual, Integrity. We are open to hiring candidates to work out of the following location: Bentonville AR; Hoboken, NJ; Bay Area, California; Seattle, WA, USA - or any of our current remote states within the USA. Basic Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in a quantitative field (engineering, economics, mathematics, statistics) 4+ years of professional experience in analytics, statistics, consulting or program / project management. Proficient in Microsoft Excel (data manipulation, macros, charts and pivot tables) and comfortable in analyzing large data sets. Ability to work efficiently in a dynamic and ambiguous environment by combining analytical rigor and judgment. Excellent communication (verbal and written) skills and an ability to present and clearly communicate complex data, derive business insights and findings to non-experts. Experience using SQL to pull data from a database. Preferred Qualifications Master's degree in Predictive Analytics, Business, Statistics, Economics, Mathematics or related field. Working knowledge of SQL or other analytical tools (R or Python) for conducting data analysis. Professional experience in forecasting or demand and supply planning. Basic Qualifications 3+ years of program or project management experience Experience using data and metrics to determine and drive improvements Experience working cross functionally with tech and non-tech teams Preferred Qualifications 3+ years of driving end to end delivery, and communicating results to senior leadership experience Thinking Adopts a broad perspective that considers data, analytics, customer insights, and different parts of the business when making plans. Focus on our Associates Diversity, Equity & Inclusion Embraces diversity in all its forms and actively supports diversity of ideas and perspectives, as well as diversity goal programs. Collaboration & Influence Builds strong and trusting relationships with team members and business partners; works collaboratively to achieve objectives; communicates with impact to a range of audiences; and demonstrates energy and positivity for own work. Talent Management Contributes to an environment allowing everyone to bring their best selves to work, demonstrates engagement and commitment to the team, and recognizes others' contributions and accomplishments. At Walmart, we offer competitive pay as well as performance-based bonus awards and other great benefits for a happier mind, body, and wallet. Health benefits include medical, vision and dental coverage. Financial benefits include 401(k), stock purchase and company-paid life insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO (including sick leave), parental leave, family care leave, bereavement, jury duty, and voting. Other benefits include short-term and long-term disability, company discounts, Military Leave Pay, adoption and surrogacy expense reimbursement, and more. ‎ ‎ ‎ You will also receive PTO and/or PPTO that can be used for vacation, sick leave, holidays, or other purposes. The amount you receive depends on your job classification and length of employment. It will meet or exceed the requirements of paid sick leave laws, where applicable. ‎ For information about PTO, see https://one.walmart.com/notices . ‎ ‎ Live Better U is a Walmart-paid education benefit program for full-time and part-time associates in Walmart and Sam's Club facilities. Programs range from high school completion to bachelor's degrees, including English Language Learning and short-form certificates. Tuition, books, and fees are completely paid for by Walmart. ‎ Eligibility requirements apply to some benefits and may depend on your job classification and length of employment. Benefits are subject to change and may be subject to a specific plan or program terms. ‎ For Information About Benefits And Eligibility, See One.Walmart . ‎ Hoboken, New Jersey US-10279:The annual salary range for this position is $96,000.00-$186,000.00 ‎ San Bruno, California US-08848:The annual salary range for this position is $104,000.00-$202,000.00 ‎ Bentonville, Arkansas US-09313/Draper, Utah US-10681:The annual salary range for this position is $80,000.00-$155,000.00 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ Additional Compensation Includes Annual Or Quarterly Performance Bonuses. ‎ Additional Compensation For Certain Positions May Also Include ‎ ‎ Stock ‎ ‎ Minimum Qualifications... title: Data Analyst
description: About Us Based in Folsom CA with an office in Irvine CA, Samuel Hale is a data-driven entrepreneurial organization with a history of incubating new companies focused on Technology, Insurance, and Employment. Samuel Hale is truly unique and one of only 70 entities and municipalities granted the special designation by the State of California to resolve workers comp disputes directly with employees eliminating attorneys, fraudulent claims, and litigation costs. We enable our clients to “take back their business” in an environment where employment costs, HR compliance, and workers’ compensation premiums have prevented California business owners from focusing on what they do best... running their companies. Why Samuel Hale? We are truly niche, and our growth trajectory is crazy. We value our people, and their personal and professional development, and we are committed to your growth because we want to see you thrive! We offer great benefits, solid pay, education and certification opportunities, fun and challenging work, a welcoming and connected culture, awesome leaders, and great teammates! Our Core Values We are devoted to and passionate about the cause. We are subject matter experts. We do the right thing when no one is watching. We make it happen. We are industry revolutionaries. Samuel Hale is for you if… You have an ambitious spirit and can manage to adapt to the changing demands of a fast-paced high-performance environment. You are motivated by innovation, growth, and opportunities to learn. You get excited at the opportunity to overcome obstacles and succeed in the face of naysayers. You enjoy getting together with others to hash it out and find a creative solution to your and others’ problems. You like being in the trenches with your team rolling up your sleeves to get it done. You are not afraid to put in the work and enjoy the thrill of hard-fought success. Essential Functions Create complex reports for internal teams and/or external clients Collaborate with team members to collect and analyze data Use graphs, infographics, and other methods to meaningfully visualize and represent data Structure large data sets to find usable information Work with a team of analysts and other associates to process large sets of data and client information Create presentations and reports based on recommendations and findings from internal stakeholders Build and maintain ETL models and systems to interface with external platforms Required Experience: 3 to 5 years 1 year Experience with Microsoft SQL Server (classroom ok) 1 year Microsoft SQL Reporting Services (classroom ok) 1 year Microsoft Power Apps (classroom ok) Experience with Microsoft C# (classroom ok) Required Education: Undergraduate Degree A bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field is preferred. High concentration/intensity, which includes prolonged mental effort. Strong memory, taking into consideration the amount and type of information. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate to high.

title: Senior Business Data Analyst
description: Overview Intuit’s Identity Analytics team is looking for a hands-on Senior Business Data Analyst who is a creative problem solver with a passion to deliver advanced data-driven solutions. You will work alongside other Analysts, Product Managers, Designers, Engineers, Architects, and Program Managers to evolve Intuit’s Identity capabilities within Intuit’s Platform. As a key member of the analytics team, you will have a strong track record of combining advanced analytical skills with exceptional business and entrepreneurial acumen. You will also have an ownership mindset with a strong willingness to take on new challenges with enthusiasm. This is an exciting time to join the Identity Analytics team at Intuit as we are building many new cutting-edge capabilities. These include a next-generation Verified Identity Network, password-less authentication powered through passkeys, Generative AI experiences, modern and sophisticated fraud prevention, centralized user and account management, and much more. Data is central to Intuit’s decision-making process, and analysts are a critical component to evangelize data-driven decisions as we transform and scale Identity capabilities to power Intuit’s future growth. What you'll bring 5+ years of experience working in web, marketing, product, or other related analytics fields with a strong knowledge of statistics Exceptional SQL skills and experience working with granular web and native clickstream data Highly proficient in Tableau, Qliksense, Excel, or similar software Exceptional ability to take initiative, be a self-starter, and solve problems Outstanding communications skills with the ability to influence decision makers and build consensus with teams Proactive and inquisitive learner who seeks out and capitalizes on opportunities for change that enhance the business, rather than reacting to circumstances Strong organizational skills, time management, accountability, and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously to meet objectives and key deadlines Love mentoring and guiding others on best practices. Passionate about the advancement of the whole team Experience in programming languages, automation tools, and stats packages (e.g. Python) is a plus; comfortable creating re-usable data pipelines How you will lead Partner with cross functional teams to drive data-backed decisions and actionable insights Use a hypothesis-driven approach to drive design, implementation, and analysis of A/B experiments. Then provide executive level recommendations on next steps based on the test results and insights Communicate analytical findings and recommendations in a clear and concise way to non-technical audiences, both in writing and through oral presentations Provide guidance and thought leadership to business leaders and stakeholders on how best to harness available data to support business goals Ensure data collection and data processing is optimized to provide crystal-clear visibility into the impact and value of new initiatives and product releases Identify opportunities for developing new data sources, and provide technical leadership around making those data sources high-quality and broadly available Pursue data quality, troubleshoot data anomalies, validate data accuracy, and drive issues to resolution Share responsibility for owning and maintaining the analytics backlog, connecting directly with partners and stakeholders to communicate and align on priorities

title: Sr Business Intelligence Analyst I
description: Who is Taco Bell? Taco Bell was born and raised in California and has been around since 1962. We went from selling everyone’s favorite Crunchy Tacos on the West Coast to a global brand with 8,200+ restaurants, 350 franchise organizations, that serve 42+ million fans each week around the globe. We’re not only the largest Mexican-inspired quick service brand (QSR) in the world, we’re also part of the biggest restaurant group in the world: Yum! Brands. Much of our fan love and authentic connection with our communities are rooted in being rebels with a cause. From ensuring we use high quality, sustainable ingredients to elevating restaurant technology in ways that hasn’t been done before… we will continue to be inclusive, bold, challenge the status quo and push industry boundaries. We’re a company that celebrates and advocates for different, has bold self-expression, strives for a better future, and brings the fun while we’re at it. We fuel our culture with real people who bring unique experiences. We inspire and enable our teams and the world to Live Más. At Taco Bell, we’re Cultural Rebels. Want to join in on the passion-fueled fun? Learn more about the career below. About The Job The role of a Sr. Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for providing global data management and analytics platforms and services across all lines of business at Taco Bell to increase engineering productivity, accelerate the delivery of technology solutions and deliver insights. This work will impact the ability of the brand to become truly a data-driven organization. Data-rich environments such as Taco Bell’s creates numerous opportunities to grow business and increase customer satisfaction while winning in a very competitive sector of the economy. With this role, the opportunities are endless as a key team member on the Technology team, you will be part of the exciting transition Taco Bell is making in the digitization of the business. You will be helping lead the way as Taco Bell continues to transform and innovate the Quick Service Restaurant industry. You will be managing highly strategic initiatives that enable exciting and engaging technology and digital experiences for our consumers and team members. The Sr. BI Analyst will report to the Sr. Manager Architecture and Reliability. The Day-to-Day Design, develop, and maintain advanced data visualizations, reporting, and storytelling using the Power BI reporting tool. Responsible for implementing solutions for data problems, providing guidance on complex data issues. Design and create optimized physical/logical data models and relationships required to facilitate advanced data visualization creation based on business requirements. Create and maintain enhanced SQL queries for report data validation and performance optimization. title: Data Analyst
description: What are we looking for in our Data Analyst? This individual will be driving the efforts on the Growth team, which enables the company to seamlessly talk to its users to maximize the long-term impact. We build features that help scale how we communicate and target users across different user lifecycles. title: Senior Marketing Data Analyst
description: Sendbird is excited to add a position to our Data Analytics team! As a Senior Marketing Data Analyst , you will be synthesizing insights to drive critical decision-making and achieve successful business outcomes for our global organization. You will be an integral member of the Sendbird Data Analytics team with a strong dotted line to the Marketing and Growth team. You will be responsible for building strong partnerships, defining key metrics, ensuring instrumentation and data availability, and advancing analytic objectives across our business domains. About The Team The Data Analytics team is a part of the Revenue Operations organization that also includes Strategy/Planning, Marketing Operations, and Sales Operations. Across the lead-to-cash cycle, we own the processes, systems, and analytics for driving Go To Market leadership, alignment, and excellence. Who You Are An analyst with a strong voice for data-driven decision-making and 360 transparency. A superstar who can go beyond the dashboard, able to deal with data from multiple sources and varying levels of completeness/accuracy. Deeply experienced with data enrichment, hygiene, transformation, and visualization. A self-motivated individual with sound business/risk judgment. Able to create structure in ambiguous situations. High emotional quotient and strong communication skills. Effective in project management and working across teams. What You Will Do Work with relevant stakeholders to establish key metrics. You will determine baselines/goals for major initiatives (e.g. quarterly OKRs) and for specific projects (campaign ROI, product adoption/usage, etc). Partner with other teams to set up and onboard dashboards, train for self-sufficiency on usage and standard reporting, and field requests for more complex requests (joins, statistical analysis, etc). Identify gaps in data and proactively solve them by aligning with stakeholders to ensure we are correctly instrumented and have availability of data in proper structure and formats. Organize our data definitions, taxonomy, collection strategies, system hierarchies, etc. Report weekly on key metrics with commentary on any significant changes. Report monthly and/or quarterly on ad-hoc investigations to communicate any surprising trends or movements. Analyze historical data to track performance, identifying levers for change, and areas for improvement. You will be our champion for implementing data best practices across Sendbird’s global organization. What You Bring 5+ Years of experience as an Analyst or in a Data Insights role at a B2B Saas growth company. 3+ Years of relevant experience in Inbound/Outbound Marketing measurement, Product Led Growth and Sales Led Growth, and Account-Based Marketing and Selling. The ability to manipulate and query with SQL is mandatory; Python and/or R is a plus. Looker / Excel / Google Sheets guru. Bachelor’s Degree with a science or technical focus, A Master’s degree is a plus. Consulting experience is a plus. Compensation Our US benefits include (but are not limited to) 20 days PTO, 12 paid US company holidays, 5 sick days, 2 volunteer days, plus a rest/rejuvenation and birthday day off Company subsidized medical, dental, vision insurance Flexible Spending Accounts or Health Savings Accounts, depending on your selected health insurance plan Equity program 401K program Parental leave Life and disability insurance Be Your Best Self: An annual stipend of $3,500 (prorated by start date) for expenses ranging from professional development classes and training, to personality assessments, gym memberships, books, fitness classes, mental health services and massages Pay Transparency For cash compensation, we set standard ranges for all roles based on function, level, and geographic location. To determine our ranges, we utilize a variety of compensation data benchmarked against similar-stage growth companies. A reasonable estimate of the current salary range for this role is $120,000 - $155,000. This range is specific to the San Francisco Bay market. We consider several factors when making final compensation decisions including, but not limited to, skill sets, experience and training, licensure and certifications, and other business and organizational needs which may cause your specific offer to vary from the amount listed above. Flexible Work Policy We offer a flexible work schedule at Sendbird. We also value collaboration and relationship building. With those values in mind, we require for all employees within an hour commute range of their local office to gather with their team in office three times per week as a minimum. Some of our roles require a more frequent in-office schedule. Please work with your manager to understand the office time requirements for your position. What Diversity And Inclusion Mean To Us There is no such thing as a perfect candidate and the best employees come from a wide range of backgrounds, experiences, and skillsets. Sendbird is a place where everyone can learn and grow. We respect, promote, and encourage diversity for equal employment opportunities and encourage you to apply if this role excites you. About Sendbird At Sendbird, we are building the most scalable and powerful chat API in the world with a mission to build connections in a digital world. Conversations have always been the way people build relationships and get things done and our goal is to put the power of conversations in the hands of every developer and brand by making apps more social through chat, voice and video. Sendbird is rapidly growing unicorn start-up headquartered in San Mateo, CA with additional offices in; New York, London, Seoul, Singapore, and Bengaluru and has raised over $220M with a $1 Billion+ valuation from leading investors, including: ICONIQ Capital, STEADFAST Capital Ventures, Tiger Global Management, Shasta Ventures, Softbank Vision Fund 2, and Y Combinator.

title: Data Analyst
description: Who We Are AMAZING INDIVIDUALS WORKING FOR POSITIVE PEOPLE at AIDS Healthcare Foundation! Does the idea of doing something that really makes a difference in people’s lives while being well-compensated intrigue you? Are you looking to work for an organization that encourages growth and success from each and every one of its employees? If so, AIDS Healthcare Foundation is the place for you! Founded in 1987, AIDS Healthcare Foundation is the largest specialized provider of HIV/AIDS medical care in the nation. Our mission is to provide cutting edge medicine and advocacy, regardless of ability to pay. Through our healthcare centers, pharmacies, health plan, research and other activities, AHF provides access to the latest HIV treatments for all who need them. AHF’s Core Values Are To Be Patient-Centered Value Employees Respect for Diversity Nimble Fight for What’s Right STILL INTERESTED? Please continue! YOUR CONTRIBUTION TO OUR SUCCESS! Job Description Utilize data modeling and optimizing methods to develop and interpret healthcare information in order to assist AHF management with decision making, policy formulation, and other managerial functions for our healthcare operations. Design, implement, and test inbound and outbound data processes related to all aspects of AIDS Healthcare Foundation’s Managed Care healthcare programs for patients living with HIV and/or AIDS. Work directly with AHF’s Associate Director of Data and Information Architecture to create data solutions for internal clients, as well as interface with staff in order to meet mutual contractual requirements. Provide ongoing insightful reports and analyses that will support information-based decision making and strategy execution measures. Identify opportunities for improving existing processes at AHF using data modelling methods. Maintain data interfaces, uploads, transmissions, reports, and analytics for AHF’s medical records, Pharmacy Benefit Data, and claims data from Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) X12 data sources. Develop solutions with proprietary claim adjudication systems such as HEALTHsuite. Extract and analyze data sets to develop findings and recommendations for strategy and execution measures. Ensure security and integrity while following HIPAA guidelines during data transmissions. Analyze information obtained from data extractions to conceptualize and define operational problems using database software such as MSSQ SQL, T-SQL, RDBMS, and PowerBI. Requirements Bachelor’s degree, or equivalent, in Business Intelligence, Economics, Statistics, or a related field plus two (2) years of Business intelligence analysis, data analysis, or related experience: pulling and cleaning large data sets from internal and external sources; fitting, tuning, and validating a wide array of statistical models; integrating predictive models into analytical tools; devising new modeling techniques and devising new metrics; developing, evaluating, and delivering new models as part of the product development lifecycle; analyzing statistical and financial data in large and complex datasets; applying state of the art machine learning algorithms and statistical models; developing scalable solutions and tools; and utilizing R, Python, SQL, and SAS. Telecommuting permissible one (1) day a week. Work Schedule 40 hours per week Salary $84,000.02/year Location: Los Angeles, CA To apply, send resume to: Liliana Zoldi, Director of HR, AIDS Healthcare Foundation, 6255 W. Sunset Boulevard, 21st Floor, Los Angeles, CA 90028 or email; talentacquistion@ahf.org AHF Commitment We at AIDS Healthcare Foundation believe that each individual is entitled to equal employment opportunities without regard to race, color, creed, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status or disability. The right of equal employment opportunity extends to recruiting, hiring selection, transfer, promotion, training and all other conditions of employment. AHF will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the ordinance.

title: Data Analyst II
description: The Data Analyst II participates as a technical resource in data analysis, data integration (e.g., inspecting, cleansing, validating, transforming, and modeling), and data management. Utilizes a thorough knowledge of data analysis, information systems data structures, and data management methodologies to align business insight with corporate goals and strategies. The Data Analyst II coordinates and assists with requirements gathering sessions internal customers and presents their findings to the business unit. •Communicates with cross-functional teams to align data activities to key business goals and initiatives •Generates custom analytics and performs data analysis using statistical techniques and analytics tools. Present findings to leadership •Conducts data integration and database data management for use by various units and business processes •Identifies and interprets trends or patterns in complex data •Generates custom reports and performs data analysis using statistical techniques •Creates data models for efficient systems usage and performance analysis •Creates data flows diagrams and visualizations to communicate information clearly and effectively •Writes database queries and stored procedures to streamline development needs of developers and project teams •Acquires data from primary and secondary data sources and ensures accuracy, consistency, timeliness and integrity of data •Works with business units to prioritize business and information needs and align analytics to business processes •Creates data architecture models and reference architecture; collaborates with IT resources to validate and implement strategic data technologies •Documents logical data structure (e.g., data mapping from source to target), field definitions, and any calculations and transformations along the data pipeline Qualificatio ns Min/Preferred- Education Lev el:4 Year / Bachelors Deg reeDescriptio n: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience in statistics, data analysis, data mining, computer science or information management. Experi ence Minimum Years of Experience :2 Preferred Years of Experience:4 Comme nts:2-4 years of experience in data analysis or digital analytics required. 2-4 years of experience in data reporting required. Knowledge, Skills & Ability• Must have a solid knowledge of Microsoft Excel and be comfortable working with spreadsheets and complex formulas. •Fluent in SQL and data manipulation within a multi-terabyte cloud environment •Experience in all aspects of data management involving large data sets (data gathering, profiling, validation, and analysis). •Experience with creating data flow diagrams (e.g., mapping documents) and requirements documents. •Ability to clearly communicate with managers and associates at all levels. •Experience with Tableau, MicroStrategy, PowerBI, or other established BI tools preferred. •Experience with and understands “Big Data” concepts and technologies such as Hadoop preferred. •Experience with cloud technologies such as AWS and Azure preferred .•Experience with financial systems preferred. •Python or R experience preferred. Corporate Values • Practic e open Commun ication with all level s ; • Be Accou ntable by taking ownership of customer issues and responsibility for one’s actions; • F oster Te amwork by cooperating and collaborating with other employees; • Seek ways to make the wor k pla ce Fun for oneself &others; • Conduct onesel f with Int egrity by being honest, trustworthy and ethical in all work activities and interactions; • Work w ith a Service Orie ntation by having a genuine concern for the needs of one’s customers and by being friendly, professional and following through on commitments; and • Demon s trate Hu mility in all interactions and remember to leave one’s ego at the door when one arrives t o work. title: Analyst, Data Governance Customer & Brand
description: SUMMARY: The Data Admin and Governance Manager will lead new business setup operations as well as data maintenance for proprietary GWFG systems. They will react with speed and efficiency when new business is acquired, and new items are created. They will also ensure to maintain current items, specs, and other necessary information to continue to grow sales. This dynamic role will be met with a requirement to move with urgency as they meet the needs of all cross-functional teams within GWFG. This role will report to the Director of Retail Strategy. RESPONSIBILITIES: •Setup newly acquired customers for domestic and international business •Create new items including UPCs with databases such as GS1, GS1 Canada, 1WorldSync, etc. •Maintain current item profiles within databases already listed •Track accruals and demos for customers such as Costco, Sam’s Club and Trader Joe’s •Work cross-functionally with teams such as Finance to identify customer deductions and deal memo verification •Create and maintain specs for all items within the GWFG portfolio, including international •Work with our Sales team to ensure online marketplace profiles for GWFG items are up to date with the correct specifications •Support deal management via DemandTec, Smart & Final, SV Harbor/UNFI, etc. •Support bidding processes across multiple customers •Support coupon setup utilizing Mandlik & Rhodes •Execute distributor setup to include KeHE, Titanium Canada, RJW, etc. •Support the maintenance of the National Price List •Support and provide deal memos to the sales team REQUIREMENTS: •Demonstrated strong analytical and strategic thinking skills are required •Strong communication skills are required •Strong collaborator with a demonstrated ability to work cross-functionally •Proven ability to effectively manage multiple projects in a dynamic environment is required •Proficiency with Microsoft Excel and other Office suites •Attention to detail is required •Ability to adapt to the pace of an essential team

title: Data Analyst V - US
description: Role: Data Analyst V Location: San Jose, CA - hybrid( 3 days onsite) Top skills: Data Analysis, Business Analytics, Python, SQL, Tableau, SEO, A/B testing. Day to Day Responsibilities of this Position and Description of Project: Performs complex data analysis in support of ad-hoc and standing management or customer requests. Develops programs, methodologies, and files for analyzing and presenting data. Uses and supports database applications and analytical tools. Evaluates data quality, applications, and functions. Produces output and maintains operation. Researches new data sources and analytical tools. Contributes to new product development and improvement in product delivery and presentation. Develops awareness of and familiarity with issues and events affecting organization, department, and/or customer. Uses timely and appropriate participation of users/customers in data collection and query systems.: Provides accurate and appropriate interpretation of data, applying knowledge to evaluation, analysis, and interpretation of data. Develops appropriate methodologies for collecting, analyzing, and presenting data products. Develops useful and insightful information from a variety of data sources. Works with management and/or customers to develop and understand product specifications. Communicates regularly and effectively with team members and management, and communicates results effectively to management and/or customers. Delivers data products in report/presentation format, or verbally, to management and/or customer specifications and timelines. Points out system or process problems when noticed and engages the team in problem solving. Facilitates satisfactory communication and resolution of problems. We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join the Buyer Taxonomy and Site Navigation team to assess the opportunity and measure the impact of projects related to changing the browse navigation experience on eBay. Your focus will be supporting various product launches to measure the impact on customer behavior and SEO (search engine optimization). In addition to robust statistical knowledge, it is vital to have strong intellectual curiosity, and a passion for achieving practical business impact. Skills in quantitative analysis, problem definition, and an attention to detail are required. Responsibilities Work with product partners to find practical solutions to our business problems based on data. This will require an ability to translate problems stated in business terms into quantitative approaches leading to projects starting small and aspiring to grow big if preliminary results are promising. Set up testing (A/B test or pre-post) to measure performance in the best possible way Analyze large sets of data to understand the impact of product changes on the customer journey and to traffic/revenue goals. Drive cohort studies and drive analyses to understand customer behavior and find opportunities for improving our product(s) Transform scientific/data analysis and communicate business performance in a clear and insightful way to the product teams to facilitate timely and informed decision-making Ensure statistical rigor is applied to all analyses and business recommendations Requirements A Bachelor's Degree in Statistics/Mathematics or quantitative field required (or equivalent experience equivalent) 10+ years of experience as a business analyst, data scientist, or related field Understanding of statistics, experimental design, and causal inference. Excellent SQL skills as well as experience with common data and statistical toolkits such as R, Python, PySpark etc. Expertise with business intelligence and/or data visualization tools such as Tableau, MicroStrategy, etc. Prior experience in performance measurement, creatively applying regression techniques / modeling, optimization techniques, A/B testing, etc. for business applications The skills to translate analytical insights into clear recommendations and effectively deliver it to technical and non-technical partners An ability to spot and pursue opportunities as well as to translate high-level directions into practical projects and lead/drive their completion with minimal supervision. Excellent written, verbal, and social skills with the ability to communicate with all levels in the organization in a clear, timely and effective manner

title: Data Analyst (1229)
description: Are you an experienced and self-motivated Data Analyst looking to advance your career? If so, Kooner Fleet Management Solutions wants you to join our growing team! We are seeking a Data Analyst with 3-5 years of experience to analyze data, generate reports, and identify trends, operational inefficiencies, and cost drivers. The ideal candidate will develop Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) to support strategic decision-making and enhance operational efficiency across the business. This position will be based out of our corporate office in Sacramento, CA and will require to be in-office 5 days per week. Why Kooner Fleet Management Solutions? Kooner FMS has grown to become one of the largest Emergency Road Service companies in the U.S. and is a leading provider of onsite mobile maintenance and repair services nationwide, offering mobile onsite fleet service for light, medium, and heavy-duty trucks and trailers. Excellent Benefits: Competitive Pay: $85-100K Salary Medical, Dental, Vision 401K Match Life Insurance More Perks Coming Soon! What the Data Analyst role looks like: Analyze datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and insights that can drive business decisions. Prepare and present detailed reports on findings, including visualizations and actionable recommendations. Identify operational inefficiencies and provide data-driven recommendations for process improvements. Monitor and analyze cost drivers to optimize expenditures and improve profitability. Develop, track, and report on KPIs to measure performance across various departments. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and deliver tailored solutions. Ensure data accuracy and integrity through regular audits and validation checks. Utilize data visualization tools to create dashboards and reports that communicate key metrics and insights effectively. Stay updated with industry trends and advancements in data analytics tools and techniques. What our ideal candidate looks like: Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or a related field. 3-5 years of experience in data analysis, preferably in a fleet maintenance or logistics environment. Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, Excel, Python, R, or similar. Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen eye for detail. Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex data in a clear and concise manner. Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously. Preferred Qualifications: Experience with fleet management software and systems. Knowledge of the automotive or logistics industry. Advanced statistical analysis skills and experience with machine learning techniques. Environment: Standard office setting Must be able to lift up to 10 lbs Must be able to sit for up to 4 hours at a time Kooner Fleet Management Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and applicants, free from discrimination and harassment. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We celebrate diversity and are dedicated to fostering a workplace where every team member can thrive. Kooner Fleet Management Solutions participates in E-Verify for employment eligibility verification.

title: Data & Business Analyst
description: Cognizant is a large IT Consulting Firm that leverages modern technologies to transform various businesses. Our innovative teams of sales ops support specialists work together on scalable solutions for our internal customers, supporting their needs. This means that team members need to be proactive, motivated, organized, responsible, and able to work well in a fast-paced environment. In this role, you will support the Data Quality projects including Business Analysis for various programs. As part of the team, you will be responsible for resolving complex data projects, analysis that sales teams, managers and programs face daily and quarterly. This role will require smooth execution and implementation of solutions while communicating with stakeholders and sales. Please not that this role is 100% onsite in San Jose, CA. Only local candidates will be considered. Role Responsibilities Conduct non-routine end-to-end analyses, including data gathering from large and complex data sets, processing with ongoing deliverables to improve the quality Build code to perform impact analysis on system wide issues to support business decisions Perform ad-hoc analysis for cross-functional teams to provide key insights Create and maintain dashboard for cross-functional partners to drive key business decisions Understanding the client's problem and identifying the right research questions from data perspective Corralling the data needed for analysis by cleaning, linking, and structuring different datasets Bringing the results together in a narrative and communicating it effectively Be responsible for formulating study hypotheses and determining appropriate analytical methods and procedures, with minimal oversight, documentation, or defined process Work with management to improve statistical integrity, accuracy, and adequacy of the team’s deliverables Provide mentorship and guidance to other team members regarding data analytics Build effective working relationships with upper management and cross-functional teams Work efficiently in a fast-paced environment and meet critical deadlines Multi-task and prioritize requests to meet the most important and urgent business need Required Qualifications Minimum of 8 years in Data / Business analysis relevant experience Education: Bachelor's or Master's degree is a must (Preferred - Computer Science / Engineering stream) Strong proficiency in SQL scripting and analyzing datasets Knowledge of different modeling and data mining techniques Ability to troubleshoot issues working with Service Desk, escalating to other teams as needed. Intermediate to Advanced experience in Python, SAS, JavaScript, Tableau, and Power BI Strong proficiency in analyzing datasets using relational databases including SQL queries, database definition, and schema design Effective communicator with peers, management, and cross-functional stakeholders Creative problem solving and analytical skills Confident user of Microsoft Excel and/or Google Sheets Preferred Qualifications Programming: Intermediate to Advanced experience in Python, R, Base SAS, JavaScript Reporting: Intermediate experience in Tableau or similar data visualization tools. Proficient in managing multiple tasks while maintaining a consistent and strict attention to detail Salary And Other Compensation The annual salary for this position is between $57,000 – $67,000 depending on experience and other qualifications of the successful candidate. This position is also eligible for Cognizant’s discretionary annual incentive program, based on performance and subject to the terms of Cognizant’s applicable plans. Benefits: Cognizant offers the following benefits for this position, subject to applicable eligibility requirements: Medical/Dental/Vision/Life Insurance Paid holidays plus Paid Time Off 401(k) plan and contributions Long-term/Short-term Disability Paid Parental Leave Employee Stock Purchase Plan Disclaimer: The salary, other compensation, and benefits information is accurate as of the date of this posting. Cognizant reserves the right to modify this information at any time, subject to applicable law. Cognizant will only consider applicants for this position who are legally authorized to work in the United States without requiring company sponsorship now or at any time in the future.

title: Data Analyst, Instrumentation
description: Overview Of The Company Fox Corporation Under the FOX banner, we produce and distribute content through some of the world’s leading and most valued brands, including: FOX News Media, FOX Sports, FOX Entertainment, FOX Television Stations and Tubi Media Group. We empower a diverse range of creators to imagine and develop culturally significant content, while building an organization that thrives on creative ideas, operational expertise and strategic thinking. Job Description This particular role is focused on the analysis, design, planning, development, implementation, and testing of analytical tracking solutions for FOX websites, mobile apps, and connected TV (OTT) apps. Key functions include, but are not limited to, meeting with internal stakeholders to understand business objectives and define data driven measurement goals, designing and documenting solutions to track these objectives, coordinating the technical implementation of analytics tags & SDKs with internal and external development teams, automating the implementation of data analytics tags via a tag manager, debugging, configuring reports and dashboards and testing and troubleshooting the implementation. The role is also responsible for providing guidance and best practices to analysts, full stack data engineers, product owners, marketers, and other stakeholders to achieve business objectives. a Snapshot Of Your Responsibilities You should have a strong background with a variety of SaaS measurement platforms and data visualization tools like Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, Tableau, Comscore, and Nielsen, and understands how to use these tools to perform analyses and reporting as well as how to implement and configure the tags and SDKs that power them. You should also be similarly familiar with data collection and tag management platforms like Segment, Tealium, Google Tag Manager etc, as well as familiarity with cloud base data platforms like AWS Redshift, S3, EMR, Snowflake, etc. Knowledge with the technical workings of analytics tools from SDK implementation to the actual network request. Strong candidates will have experience running analyses and queries with both software front-ends and via SQL/Python. In addition, excellent communication skills and the ability to clearly articulate and document measurement requirements and capabilities to both non-technical and technical stakeholders is required. Knowledge of computer science and programming languages like Javascript, Objective C, and Java is highly preferred. Manage analytics implementation workflow Build data models, define data strategy and analytics implementation reflecting current and anticipated future stakeholder needs Define, document, and maintain requirements for specific measurement goals Manage internal and external engineers on implementation of tags/SDKs/data APIs Design and Implement analytics tags via tag manager Configure reports via admin console and tag management platforms or using SQL/Python, Define processing logic, manage user permissions Debug and validate the implementations Strategy and Guidance Meet with stakeholders to understand business objectives Demonstrate and document ways to perform analyses and gain insights via analytics solutions Perform analyses and create reports to directly support business stakeholders and internal teams Evangelize data-driven decision-making and best practices Quality Assurance Ability to test and validate data collection to ensure proper functioning end-to-end What You Will Need Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Marketing, Business, Statistics, or other related fields Background in an analytical or engineering role Good knowledge of data analytical, engineering standards and methodologies Experience implementing analytics and audience measurement tools Hands on SQL experience Experience with SaaS front end tools like Adobe Analytics (Omniture) or Google Analytics Experience with data collection platforms (Segment, Tealium, Ensighten, Adobe DTM, Snowplow etc.) Experience with implementing custom javascript tags, analytics tags and pixels via tag manager Familiarity with testing tools like Charles Proxy, Fiddler, Wireshark, or browser developer tools Front end debugging experience Strong analytical, problem-solving, mathematical, and creative thinking skills Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Desire to work in a fast-paced, data-intensive environment Passion for digital media and technology Programming experience with Javascript NICE TO HAVE, BUT NOT A DEAL BREAKER Programming experience with languages like Objective C, Java, Brightscript, C++, etc Prior experience with digital video, television, or entertainment fields Familiarity with Agile software development workflows and related tools (JIRA, Confluence, Zendesk, etc) Learn more about Fox Tech at #foxtech We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with applicable law. At FOX, we foster a culture and environment where everyone feels welcome and can thrive. We are deeply committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion, including attracting, retaining, and promoting diverse talent across our company. We live in a diverse world, with different ideas and different perspectives that come together to spark new ideas and make great things happen. That means reflecting the diversity of the world around us is critical to our company’s success. We ensure that our viewers, communities and employees feel heard, represented, and celebrated both on screen and off. Pursuant to state and local pay disclosure requirements, the pay range for this role, with final offer amount dependent on education, skills, experience, and location is: $84,500.00-113,000.00 annually for California. This role is also eligible for various benefits, including medical/dental/vision, insurance, a 401(k) plan, paid time off, and other benefits in accordance with applicable plan documents. Benefits for Union represented employees will be in accordance with the applicable collective bargaining agreement.

title: Business Data Analyst (Contract) San Diego CA
description: Job Opportunity: Business Data Analyst (Contract) Location: San Diego, CA (onsite, 4 days a week) Schedule: Standard Office Hours, with occasional early (7 AM) or late (7 PM) calls Duration: 5-Month Contract (potential to extend) Pay Rate Range: $36 - $44 per hour Position Summary: A leading company in the life sciences industry is seeking a highly motivated and team-oriented Business Data Analyst to join its Global Financial Services team. This role focuses on operational excellence and supporting the global commercial sales organization. Responsibilities: Conduct detailed reviews of contracts and terms against Sales Operations checklist to identify and mitigate legal risks. Manage contract change control processes and related correspondence. Serve as a resource for contract-related inquiries and resolve operational issues. Proactively propose and implement new policies to enhance scalability and efficiency in contracting processes. Provide strategic solutions to Sales Operations leadership. Oversee the development and maintenance of a commercial contracts management database. Develop and maintain compliance-related Key Performance Indicators (KPIs). Prepare compliance reports and monitor pricing issues. Perform ad-hoc audits of Financial Services deals portfolio. Establish best practices for measuring contract management performance. Requirements: Proven experience in drafting, negotiating, and finalizing commercial or legal documents. Excellent organizational skills and the ability to perform in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment. Ability to handle multiple contract negotiations simultaneously. Mastery of contract processes including evaluation, negotiation, approval, tracking, and close-out. Strong mentorship capabilities and ability to serve as a Contracts authority. Independent working ability with sound judgment. Exacting attention to detail and proficiency in MS Office. Financial modeling understanding and knowledge of financing tools (leasing, pay per use, etc.). Reporting skills, including KPI development and reporting pack preparation. Understanding of the company's business model and T&Cs. Team player with experience working in multicultural teams. Flexibility to join early or late calls as needed. Experience abroad is a plus. Education: Business-related/legal degree or equivalent industrial experience. 2-5 years of directly applicable experience, preferably in the life sciences field. Exceptional written and verbal communication skills. Join us and contribute to achieving operational excellence in a dynamic, growth-oriented company. If you have a passion for contract compliance, financial modeling, and improving processes, we encourage you to apply. ...

title: Data Analyst III
description: Title : Data Analyst III Duration: 5 months Location: Cupertino, CA (Hybrid schedule - in office on Tue, Wed and Thu) Duties Own the global Channel store merchandising landscape in preparation of a product launch: Perform data validation and scrubbing, working with inputs from regional teams Forecast store demos and security elements for product launches: Develop models based on current merchandising to forecast demand at SKU-level based on global strategy, against a fluctuating baseline Contribute to marketing strategy: Be resourceful using sales and merchandising datasets, along with tools to research and develop insights that contribute to strategy decisions Tell stories with data every day: Propose and defend your ideas with strong research and compelling analyses to internal cross-functional team and sales/marketing leadership stakeholders NPI Project management: Lead projects across internal planning, merchandising, supply/demand and country/regional teams to ensure forecast accuracy and supply availability within a defined schedule A mix of team & independent work: manage your deliverables and deadlines independently, but connect everything to the bigger picture with your colleagues; communicate the status and results of your independent projects to cross-functional forums Hard Skills : Very strong Excel and data management; Data visualizations (Tableau/Power BI), analysis and reporting across several levels of the organization; MacOS and iOS; Experience with supply/demand planning, inventory management or retail merchandising an asset Soft Skills Detail-oriented; Comfortable working in an extremely agile, collaborative, fast-paced environment with a lot of ambiguity; comfortable working with highly sensitive information; resourceful; deadline-driven; strong problem solving; ability to prioritize multiple, conflicting deliverables; Ideal candidates would have a passion for data storytelling, problem solving, and an interest in collaborating with others to shape the in-store experience for a major tech brand Education Bachelor’s degree or data analysis certifications preferred. MBA or master’s in data science a plus.
